Akhen BOT 14-11-2022 04:48
The first thing one would notice upon entering the town of Krezk is the overwhelming sense of dread, though I suppose that's understandable. Losing friends and family en masse is tough, and I'm not sure the people of Krezk will ever be able to return to normalcy, or at least as much normalcy one can have in Barovia. Even if we do succeed, they most likely won't be able to get back those they lost to this horrid plague. Worst of all is that they end up being reminded of those people that they lost each night, seeing husks of their loved ones amongst the hoards of rats He stops writing as the bearded man makes his remark "Our apologies that we couldn't come sooner, we wished to help those of Krezk who were leaving for Vallaki and I'm sure you understand as well as anybody else that those roads aren't safe at night."
Slade BOT 14-11-2022 13:17

DM [Griz] BOT 19-11-2022 13:11
The grumpy man let's out a long, exacerbated sigh and slowly stands up straight from the focused lean he had been holding over the map. "They chose their fate when they *abandoned* Krezk. You should have left them to their own. Instead, we suffered more losses, and are now in even worse shape. The truth remains that we need help.. and you're the only ones standing here..." The room continues to bustle about you, people down the rear and packing small boxes, there is a large burly man in the corner who seems to be working a small forge, the few advisors to the Burgomaster stand quietly by as he looks you all up and down. "You certainly look the part, looks means nothing around here though, and in my experience jsut sees you to the grave quicker... People 'xpecting too much. I expect very little. And I loathe to ask for outside help, but our plague is so rampant I'm not sure I have any other options. So, should you still want to help..." He sighs a little "The job stands."
Akhen BOT 19-11-2022 22:22

DM [Griz] BOT 28-11-2022 01:50
As everyone takes their seats the man remains standing and looms over the large map on the table. "So, as I am sure you're aware by now, we have a bit of a rat problem. Except these are rodents of unusual size to say the least. At first... weeks ago, it was just *normal* rats, you know? No one would have known. But they grew in size, and in number, just last night when you were *supposed to be here* we were hit again and Agatha's son Henry was taken from his bed, **his bed!**" He composes himself for a moment, before continuing "There seems to be from, what we have observed, a few possible locations these vermin are stirring. All of them within town or just outside the walls. However we have been so busy trying to repair and prepare to be safe that we've not had the resources to investigate as well as we should have." He points to the map on the table, drawing attention to the red ink markings around particular residential properties.
GRIÃ∂Z ‚ï† Seron¬≥ ‚ï£ 28-11-2022 01:50
DM [Griz] BOT 28-11-2022 01:58
"These are the properties with the most sightings. In the north of Town there is the Volkov's place, they were actually one of the first families to loose someone early on... at that time we thought that Alice had just run away. It was a few weeks before her parents were taken too. No one has been in there since. In the south of town there is the Baranov residence, I've not heard of many issues there myself, and as far as I have been informed no one has gone missing there, but people have reported rats disappearing *to* there as they leave at night. We haven't really seen where though. Finally, there is the Sokova's outside town. They are good people, they provide us with grain and have always been reliable citizens of Krezk, even if just outside our walls. No one has seen them since before all this began, the grain shortage in part is due to their apparent disappearance. No one has seen any rats nearby, but just the timing of their vacancy seems... unusual." He looks up from the map to you all "So.. this is what we have. I would suggest given the time in the day you stay here with us this evening and discuss your plans among yourselves. Jereth, our smith, will be here, as will some of the townsfolk who are still displaced while we repair their homes, you are all welcome to a bed out the back. You can make your way at first light, and I would suggest you best try resolve the issue before dark tomorrow."

DM [Griz] BOT 05-12-2022 01:01
Jereth spends some time down the rear of the room at his minature forge, he works away on two reasonably large contraptions which as parts are complete, he begins to erect defensively in the room. "You know, you lot might save us yet... these kinds of ideas are great, and if only we could be covering the town with them you know? These fuckin' rats... They deserve to be sent back to whatever hell they came from." The man pauses for a second and wipes his eyes. "I am not even sure they'll come here tonight, its just been so... random. The one thing i've noticed tho is its almost always women and children.. strange huh?" He continues to work, now with a crucible of molten silver that he drops a few silver candle holders and cutlery into. Once they melt down, he proceeds to dip in rather large metal tipped bolts, and lays them neatly in a pile on the workbench.
DM [Griz] BOT 05-12-2022 01:19
As you spend the afternoon conversing with Jereth, various locals pass through the room to the rear section, or out the front doors just going about their day. Eventually Jereth finishes his two rather intimidating contraptions which are stationed equally across the room, and pointed at the front doors. A few children run through to the back rooms, playing and laughing, blissfully unaware of the turmoil that surrounded them at any given moment in their cold, oppressive existences. During the preparations you inspect windows, check door frames, and generally inspect the building for weak points or possible issues; Slade finds that two of the hinges on the front door look a little rough, and that one of the sashed windows was missing its brass lock, outside of that the building seemed in reasonable shape for Barovia. Jereth, now letting his furnace cool, pours a small glass of whiskey and collapses into one of the plush leather chairs that sits nearby the open fire. He looks at you all, raises an eyebrow, and points to the glass. "Y're more than welcome to have a glass if its suits you? I sure need one."
Zee BOT 05-12-2022 02:02

DM [Griz] BOT 06-12-2022 22:19
Jereth nods at Slade's enquiry "Something we've considered before, but most families don't want to leave their homes, despite the risk I cannot blame them. It's not as though this kind of threat has never existed in our lives here, its just the latest in a long run of things that *is* life in Barovia. The families who have been displaced are staying out back with us here, but yeah, for most of them they are just trying to go about their lives as normal." He takes a drink and lets out a long sigh. -------------------------------- Hours pass, the group settle in after making as many preparations to the building as seems fit, and Jereth joins you at the table for a few drinks, occasionally heading back to his furnace to stoke the coals and check on irons that he has slowly tempering in the heat. As the light begins to fade, the last of the locals who are shaking up in the building return, give you polite nods, and retire to their various rooms out the back. When the last arrive Jereth locks the front door, and drops the large wooden bar across the back of it in a fashion that says "I do this daily". Evening comes, the group relax at the table with stories of their adventures. Jereth listens attentively, occasionally wide eyed at the details of the heroics you underwent... As the old wooden clock that hangs quietly in the corner strikes 11pm you're all but ready to retire, believing the preparations possibly unnecessary, and a good sleep perhaps more important. Slade however hears a soft scratching sound from somewhere nearby. Its faint, but certainly there... Along side it a burgeoning rustling sound like leaves in strong wind can be heard too. As they stand and begin to approach the source of the sound the scratching and rustling breaks into cracking and splintering as the timber of the front door, and the spaces below the windows burst inward with splintering wood under the pressure of what was now evident as an overwhelming hoard o
DM [Griz] BOT 06-12-2022 22:19
f rats... They burst into the room like a wave, Slade standing facing them manages to cry to the others still seated as they inundate the building.

Zee BOT 07-12-2022 18:31

Akhen BOT 07-12-2022 19:51

DM [Griz] BOT 07-12-2022 20:33
As the room shakes and wood splinters fly every which direction from Akhen's spell the party realise that the shaking is not just from the aftermath of Shatter., Through the holes in the walls and doors the wave of rats continues, more and more piling into the building, falling over one another. As they do some rats appear double, even triple the size of others! they form a furiously writhing carpet of grey and red across the floor as they pile in...
DM [Griz] BOT 07-12-2022 20:40
As the tide of grey pulses and writes the adventurers can see that the larger rats look... different.. Their eyes are more purple in hue, rather than red. Their fur is matted and blackening somewhat. Whilst still beast, they seem less so than their smaller allies.
Zee BOT 07-12-2022 21:15
*Zee fought the weretiger Karnov family with their pride of pet tigers. They were difficult, but were ultimately defeated. He was expecting the same -- a few wererats and a few large rats. The sheer number of rats took him completely off guard. He blinked at the wave of fur, claws, teeth and eyes crashing into the room. The direness of the situation gripped him. He shook his head and attacked once more. The inky tendrils first striking the injured swarm in front of Slade, and then the large rat behind Slade. Those rats all fell, but many more poured in*

Akhen BOT 08-12-2022 01:44

DM [Griz] BOT 08-12-2022 01:59
The floor undulates, a sea of matted grey fur, of furious claws and gnashing teeth. The air is filled with the warm smell of metal as blood and bone begin to trail along the cracks in the floorboards, coagulating and darkening from red, to ruby, to brown... The room shudders with the vibrations of hundreds of tiny feet as they stampede toward the adventurers. Up chair legs and across sofas they push, the faint sound of breaking glass heard as they trample their previous entrances. With each passing second more come, like a nightmare fuelled ocean of fur. From the breaks in the building larger rats yet still come, their purple glassy eyes glowing in the shadows and followed by the slinking, vicious mists that sit outside waiting patiently to enter. Now, as bigger rats come, they appear more human than the last, albeit barely. Occasionally standing on hind legs and calling out gutturally to the swarms of smaller creatures. From inside the chaos you hear Jereth cry "I... WAS NOT... PREPARED... FOR THIS!" He has abandoned his crossbow, and now wields an immaculate, shining longsword that looks to be a masterwork of the young smith, a shame its gleaming perfection shall soon be tainted with the blood of the beasts intent on making a meal of you, and everyone else in the building...

Akhen BOT 09-12-2022 19:24
Akhen takes a step back and unleashes a string of profanities at the rats before shouting over his shoulder at Slade "I don't know, I think he ran outside!" Akhen starts to look a bit tired at this point, as the rats attacks start to take its toll
Zee BOT 09-12-2022 20:17
*Loosing his quarry, Zee heads back to the hall"
Slade BOT 09-12-2022 20:55
continues stabbing and bashing the rats surrounding him "How are you doing over there Akhen?"
Akhen BOT 09-12-2022 21:09

tonymacaroni7570 12-12-2022 15:06

DM [Griz] BOT 13-12-2022 10:53
Only a handful of rats remain, and clearly their cause lost at this point. They take a few more bites in a last ditch attempt to inflict any pain they can before proceeding to rush from your feet for the broken holes below the windows. Jereth swings his greatsword, cleaving more in half, but not totally stooping them.. As the room finally falls silent you all look around at the chaos and destruction left in the wake. Broken tables, smashed windows, doors, and walls where they rats pushed their way in, and gallons of blood that pool across the floor in varying stages of coagulation.. Jereth wipes his brow, trying to get the least amount of blood possible on himself. "That... was a lot. I mean, I knew it was a problem, I've seen them in the streets before, but certainly not like that. It was like they knew you were here, and came to prove a point or something..." He looks around, somewhat deflated. "What a mess.. this is going to take a bit to fix, but hopefully we kept the others safe, and perhaps there were no other break ins around town? Whatever the case, I don't think they will be back tonight, at least I hope not. You guys go get yourselves cleaned up, there's a bathroom down the hall on the right, once you're done pick a bed and get some rest if you can.. I will do what I can do shore up these walls and doors somewhat to get through the night, then do the same..."

DM [Griz] BOT 18-12-2022 22:42

After 5 or so minutes you all pull up at the now abandoned residence of the Volkov family. The building is quite nice, if not a little plain - this is however Barovia, plain here is quite the compliment. The windows have boards across them and around the base of the building there are several more boards covering gaps between the house and ground, a haphazard attempt perhaps to stop things entering the eery silent structure. Jereth stands silent and just looks at the building as you pull up.

The air the adventurers had felt before arriving at Krezk was similar to here - unusual in Barovia, and moreso in a seemingly abandoned house. It was difficult to see clearly through the gloom but along the edges of rugs, and running up draped curtains was small communities of mould.

Dispersing from their dark, warm and wet hiding place the rats fan out down the walls and begin to disappear from view. As Slade and Jereth walk into the room the noise has ceased as the last of the rats vanishes from sight.

DM [Griz] BOT 06-01-2023 22:56

Zee manages a litlte better, but still needs to duck somewhat. Almost immediately the dim light of the house begins to vanish into total darkness, Jereth blinks a little before speaking up. "Uh. I don't know what kinda eyes you folks have.. but I can't see a. thing down here.. just a moment." The blacksmith pulls a small contraption from his pocket and spins the wheel. Light flickers and sputters out from it as a small flame ignites and fills the tunnel with a warm orange hue. The walls are rough dirt and stone, and from what you can see ahead, lead on for some time...
Zee BOT 06-01-2023 23:09

The man once again looks a little embarrassed, clearly not the seasoned adventurer "Oh, yeah, of course... sorry." He puts his device slightly behind his palm, restricting its light to only bleeding out around 5ft from him.
DM [Griz] BOT 09-01-2023 01:58
Cautiously.... slowly... the group inch forward on their hands and knees through the dark, damp tunnel. The only sounds are those of scraping equipment against the walls, and distant dripping sounds.
Zee BOT 09-01-2023 21:02
[Zee whispers] "Zee see light. Zee sneak ahead first." He then disappears down the cave
DM [Griz] BOT 10-01-2023 00:53
As Zee pushes further ahead the cavern opens up somewhat, allowing them and the others to at least stand upright. The room splits off here, one hallway to the left, another to the right. From the passage to the right Zee notices the faint glow of light filtering down along the floor and in shadows that line the uneven walls.. The light Zee can see drifting down the southern cavern appears a light golden colour, almost white.. As they move up to the corner and poke their head around they see that the tunnel before them stretches out some distance, at last 40 or so feet before. That is about all Zee can see, as the light now fills the tunnel, its bright and intense, and somewhat blinding after having crawled through the comparative darkness to reach here...
Zee BOT 10-01-2023 01:37
(Zee whispers) "Wait until eyes can see" Zee waits at the edge of the light until his eyes adjust
Zee BOT 10-01-2023 03:32
After waiting a bit without his eyes properly adjusting, Zee travels inside the blinding light. He sees several figures. Unsure what to expect, he readies his spear and holds back, waiting for them to take the first move
DM [Griz] BOT 10-01-2023 03:44
The small kobold rushes into the light and tries to duck around the corner unnoticed... The large black silhouette moves quickly and without hesitation lets out a fierce, shuddering roar. Unlike that of a lion, this was more gutteral, broken in tempo and deep in timbre. within moments the sound of claws and small stampeding feet can be heard as rats swarm into the open space, down each corridor as though commended by the unknown creature... Jereth, watching Zee run off, calls out "W-wait! We-" He turns and looks to the others, wide eyed, but with just a hint of a smile across his face. "So... this is what its all bout then huh!? So be it." He turns away and rushes into the blinding light, screaming at the top of his lungs "JEEEERRREEEETTHHHHHHHHH!!! FENNNDRRIIIIIILLLLL....." He disappears into the light, firing his crossbow blindly
Slade BOT 11-01-2023 01:24

DM [Griz] BOT 11-01-2023 03:11
As the others push forward up into the room the rats begin to surge forward... humanoid figures appear within the bright light, their black silhouettes clearly all fur and points. Two of them send forth black shadow beams at Jereth and Zee, one takes purchase right in the middle of Jereth's chest, the man cries in pain as it does. The smaller packs of rats rush forward in-toe, some managing to reach Zee and begin to climb up and around their shins, taking several tiny bites out of them as they do..
Zee BOT 11-01-2023 03:53

DM [Griz] BOT 11-01-2023 04:11

Akhen BOT 11-01-2023 14:16

Slade BOT 11-01-2023 18:31

Zee BOT 13-01-2023 01:55
Zee focuses his mind and body to deliver a barrage of attacks on the swarm engulfing him. Although they try to scurry and disperse, his four attacks all find purchase and the few rats remaining from the swarm run away.
DM [Griz] BOT 16-01-2023 02:29
Jereth rushes forward behind Zee, the man hitting his stride somewhat now. As he pulls up next to the sorcerous Rat he spins on his heels, back now to the bright light and suddenly the man can see! In its bright illuminating light the he swings his sword and cleaves the rat clean through the middle, its furry halves slumping to the ground before Zee's feet. "HA! I got one! He spins and heads further to the north in pursuit of the last large rat, the tiny swarms of rats at his feet take the chance to pounce but the man is quick with his sword, and deflects their small putrid teeth. As he gets closer to the last rat he can feel the cavern shake a little, a strange sensation, but nothing that stops him from approaching his last target.
Akhen BOT 18-01-2023 03:15
Akhen tries to lash out at one of the rats with vicious words, but his spell fails to take hold, as it largely ignores his words
Zee BOT 18-01-2023 03:44
*The Kobold rushes out of the blinding light to engage the mysterious figure. The figure opens its maw and breathes out a cloud of poison as soon as Zee gets close. Zee's nimbly somersaults out of the way of the cloud, sweeping at the figure's legs with his spear as he rolls. Both the cloud and the spear miss. Once he lands on his feet, he stabs and kicks the figure, doing a little bit of damage with each hit.*
DM [Griz] BOT 18-01-2023 04:16
As Zee rushes by the remaining large rat they unleash a horrific stream of green acidic breath at them, the small kobold moving dextrously through and around behind the creature. Unlike the others this one was much taller... it looked as though perhaps it was a man, well built and with large sharp teeth and a huge tail. By its feet sat the lantern that was filling the area with bright light. It turns to Zee and snarls Jereth rushes forward following Zee up to the larger rat. DM [Griz] BOT 21-01-2023 19:47

DM [Griz] BOT 25-01-2023 04:18
Jereth, a man on a mission, keeps forging ahead through the murky tunnels... the moisture grows, and along with it the smell. It fills his nostrils with the stench of death, inescapable and complete in its intrusion. He works hard to stop the wretching as he rounds the next corner and the small clay tunnel breaks open into what seems to be a very large cavernous room.

DM [Griz] BOT 27-01-2023 05:50
As the group pile into the open cavern the can see a series of alcoves that break off in all directions. The central chamber is very large compared the spaces prior and contains several piles of bones that litter the corners. The air is thick and warm, it fogs up any glass or metal objects the party carry and is somewhat overwhelming when combined with the pungent smell of rot that permeates the entire cavern. Animals of all shapes and sizes it seems, with the occasional human skull. Drifting through the space is the soft skittering sound of claws, which echo throughout the chamber making it hard to pinpoint exactly where it comes from. Zee however manages to diffuse the subtle noises, and can hear that they seem to be coming from the north-east... They do however, pick up another noise. A soft sobbing sound. It seems to come from the passage to the south east.
DM [Griz] BOT 27-01-2023 05:52
Jereth shines the small bright lantern around the space "How bloody big *is* this thing... we would be beyond the town walls in here. These caverns seem to be decades old though... why would we never have known about them until now?"

DM [Griz] BOT 31-01-2023 05:48

DM [Griz] BOT 04-02-2023 02:26
Jereth wastes no time, rushing ahead and into the cavern, as if summoned by the crying voices that float from down the dim muddy corridor

Akhen BOT 04-02-2023 19:00

DM [Griz] BOT 05-02-2023 21:50
As the group head down the hall they see it is filled with similar alcoves to that which Zee had seen earlier, these ones however had.. cages. Large steel bars filled the open spaces that jutted off the worn cavern, each with a large lock. Judging by the metal and the smooth worn walls these cells had been here many, many years. Jereth moving ahead with the others quickly behind sees them first and turns to the others with a look of panic. "There are people locked up down here.. a woman.. and a man." He points to the side, into the third cell down.
DM [Griz] BOT 05-02-2023 21:50
As he speaks, the sobbing stops, followed by a moment of silence. Then, from the dark a woman calls with a bit of a stutter. "H-hello? Is someone there?"
Zee BOT 05-02-2023 23:18

Slade BOT 06-02-2023 16:01

Slade BOT 06-02-2023 16:12

DM [Griz] BOT 06-02-2023 20:49
The woman stands and rushes from the corner to the cage, reaching a hand out. "Oh, Oh wonderful... Please, you *have* to let us out!" The man behind her looks a little less emotional, and somewhat despondent. He walks over and places a hand on her shoulder and just looks at you.
DM [Griz] BOT 08-02-2023 05:37
The woman looks at you with pleading eyes. A deep sadness exudes from her. Up close and in the dim light there are a few features to her face which look... out of place. A few stray hairs here, a slightly pointed nose.. a whisker or two. The man stands stoically by her side. As the group looks at her, then to one another, a consensus in that moment is reached. That today was not the day they could push this task ahead. That this woman, and this man, would remain here. Trapped. They turn and begin to walk from the cells. Jereth stands there, arms slumped by his side and pleads with you, his sadness quickly turns to anger as he stats to kick the metal cell wall. Solemnly the group ventures back, and ascends back into the dim house before leaving it, and slipping into the mists outside... What would become of Jereth? Did he manage to free the pair? did he stay and sacrifice himself for the good of those who lived in the town he loved? Who knows.
Avrae BOT 08-02-2023 05:37
‚Äã
Avrae BOT 19-02-2023 22:25
‚Äã
PM
‚Äã
DM [Griz] BOT 19-02-2023 23:29
The journey is tough. The wind whips and howls as Wick, Anton, Ssra, Slade & Vigo push up the unforgiving and brutal landscape that is the peaks of Mount Baratok. The higher they ascend, the harsher the chill. Sleet falls heavy, coming in sideways as they move up the narrow mountain pass, it hits their skin like thousands of tiny needles, only made worse by the numbing cold that grips their bodies. Eventually, as they push above the clouds somewhat, the sleet passes, and a strange, crisp clarity fills the landscape around them. Only the sound of the wind softly licking the snow capped peaks above them fills the air now, and the quite crunch of snow under armored boots. After several hours of travel, the party finally lay eyes on the top of the reported tower, poking out over the next peak before them. It is huge, imposing, and silent. There is the faint sound of clicking and rhythmic grinding and as the group push into the open space before them, they can see a small foot bridge that spans a deep crevasse, the other side home to the almost 50ft tower of stacked, bleached bones. Standing silently beside it, two skeletons adorned in metallic armor look across the clearing, small purple pin pricks of light flicker deep within their eye sockets...
Anton BOT 19-02-2023 23:39
Anton was not used to these conditions. He was always more of a city mouse. All of this trekking up mountains and wind and snow... These were not things he would have chosen to endure in his previous life. But in the last few month he has changed quite a bit. He has found real friends here, of all places. And the poor denizens of this realm... They really needed help. These new altruistic feelings have plagued him and he found himself succumbing to them more and more. And this tower was just the latest of threats to the peace here. As if a crzaed vampire lord wasn't enough... As a strong gust of wind almost knocks him off his feet, the resolve in Anton grows stronger. But he's not letting any of all of this show. His best armor - his cynicism and humor. "Are we there yet? My beard is about to freeze so hard I won't be able to talk, or even worse - sing!"
Ssra BOT 19-02-2023 23:48
"You will be fine. It iss jusst a little bit of cold."
Warr [Wick 11|Ammander 7] -4 20-02-2023 00:39

And still it was cold enough to keep him from working up much of a sweat. Wick pulls down a scarf which crusted over with ice as he continued breathed through it. ‚ÄúWould be much easier if the damn wind weren‚Äôt tryin knock us back down, hey?‚Äù He points, where the tower stands ahead. ‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt think bones would keep a solid foundation.‚Äù

DM [Griz] BOT 20-02-2023 23:36
As the group push up toward the bridge the air fills with the sound of grinding and unpleasant, deep timbre "clicks". The huge tower of bone beings to rotate and twist on its axis, as though being wound up by an invisible force. From the top of the structure what appears to be the bone of a giant is launched across the clearing - it slams into Ssra and knocks them to the ground with the force of the impact. Simultaneously as it is launching the ballista, a gap opens in the bones at the base of the tower as it spins, from within it animated skeletons begin to pour our into the cold, crisp snow... The two sentries that stood at the ready beside the tower, rush forwards, each raises up a bleached boney hand which seems to shroud them with a soft black fog.

DM [Griz] BOT 22-02-2023 01:54

Still with attention focused on the druid who was emanating a softly swirling vortex of stars, the bone knight thrusts out two boney hands in front of them, sending dancing purple beams out from their fingers that plunge easily into the chest of Ssra.

A tense couple of seconds pass, and nothing happens. Anton sighs heavily "I guess potions are no good either..." He puts a shoulder beneath one of Ssra's arms, and starts dragging her surprisingly quickly away from the tower. "I'll try to take care of her. Take out that tower already!"
DM [Griz] BOT 25-02-2023 22:57
The tower groans, the bones coalesce, the air fills with deep grinding sounds as another giant bone is launched from the tower, this time striking Vigo and knocking them to the ground.

DM [Griz] BOT 27-02-2023 01:42
As the skeletons rage on, Vigo is struck by an arrow, knocking the wind out of them and sending them tumbling onto bitter snow, unconscious. The tower seems to take pleasure in their suffering, directing its minions to continue their relentless assault on the fallen party members. Despite the overwhelming odds, the party fights on, determined to overcome the dark force that controls the tower and its minions. But the tower is a powerful foe, and its control over its minions is unyielding. As the battle reaches its climax, it becomes clear that the only way to defeat the tower is to destroy it completely, and put an end to its malevolent influence once and for all.

Anton BOT 28-02-2023 00:31
The snow around Anton is no longer white. It is a red-brown slush, the mud and the blood mixing with the fresh powder. Steam is rising from any part of exposed skin on him, as he races back and forth across the battlefield. He's not one to give up. Not now, not ever. As long as he can save more lives, that's more fighting hands to help take the abomination down. The end is in sight, that things won't hold much longer. Let's just hope Anton's legs will. He rushes back into the fray, seeing another ally fall. If his bow is of no major use here, his speed still is. The heavy paladin is lifted on Anton's back, like the cleric before him. Hopefully they will get back to her on time. Only one potion left, and it will have to suffice.

DM [Griz] BOT 28-02-2023 00:35
Confusion sets in somewhat for the tower, its ability to control the minions loosens as the groaning sounds increase, and it starts to wobble on its axis in a rather worrying fashion. You can hear the sound of more bones moving up the tall structure as it beings to launch them somewhat haphazardly across the battlefield. Despite being conscious, Ssra has little time to shift out of the way of another crushing femur, it slams into them and once more consciousness leaves them.
Vigo BOT 28-02-2023 01:05
_The arrow strikes a major artery in Vigo's neck, and blood begins to pour out. As he begins to bleed out on the ground, the memories of his life start to flash by one by one. Wrestling with friends as a child. Lying about his age to join the Silent Order. Surviving the Trials. Meeting Anabel, the love of his life. His wedding. Percival's birth. Then, more recent ones. Telling Anabel he'd be back by morning. The mists. HIs first few weeks in Barovia. All of them flash before his eyes, and then disappear._ "No... no..." _With each passing memory, a fire deep inside him burns brighter, and hotter. No, he will not succumb to a fucking skeleton. He will not die here on this mountain. He will not leave his wife and child to forever wonder his fate._ "NO!" _Vigo screams, and a brief flash of divine light explodes from Vigo. He sits there in the snow, still majorly wounded, but at least the seemingly mortal arrow wound has been sealed._ "Destroy that fucking tower." _Vigo growls as he grabs his flail and begins to get up._
3
Vigo BOT 28-02-2023 02:28
_Vigo stands up from the ground and brushes the snow off his armor. Wordlessly, silently, Vigo marches over to the tower, twirling the flail at his side to build momentum. He swings and strikes once, knocking a few bones out of the structure. Then he comes back for another swings, this time with divine fire billowing out from the censer he uses as a weapon. He strikes once again, and the weapon almost cuts through the tower with an explosion of divine light. The tower collapses in a torrent of bones and skulls._
Warr [Wick 11|Ammander 7] -4 28-02-2023 02:38
As bones fall around them, Wick uses the opportunity and closes in on the skeletal sentry before him. Slade BOT 28-02-2023 03:06

DM [Griz] BOT 28-02-2023 03:11
Vigo drives their flail furiously into the side of the tower, the reverberations of its radiant energy shuddering up the sides of the structure. Bright golden light bursts out of every crack that has slowly grown in its surface, and out of every eye socket and open jaw of the skulls that litter the face of the 50ft tall towering terror. The last remaining skeletons take a few pot shots with their bows, causing significant damage to Anton as they start to run to the east, recognising the folly of their efforts. The huge structure wobbles and teeters above, while blood, bones, sinew and sweat mix to make muddied pools in the snow around everyone below. As they look up through swollen eyes at the now glowing tower it groans and creaks with a piercing shriek. It's oscillating kaleidoscopic pattern of shifting bones stops. Silence falls, like the calm before a storm. ---- Then, the groan returns as the imposing tower of flashing golden bone tips ever so slightly in the direction of the bridge, and slowly, slowly, it begins to fall....
Anton BOT 28-02-2023 06:18
Seeing Vigo fall again, right after dealing the final blow to the tower, Anton rushes back to him. He kneels besides him and pours his last potion into his mouth. He quickly taps the paladin's cheek, saying "No rest for the wicked mate." Anton quickly gets up on his feet, and looks up at the crumbling tower. "Yikes" He begins sprinting across the bridge, yelling back to everyone "GET OUT OF THERE QUICKLY! IT'S GOING TO BLOW!"

DM [Griz] BOT 28-02-2023 20:41
The archers continue to flee off to the east, but that does not stop them loosening a few more arrows at the party while they do, a few taking purchase on Anton and Ssra. The tower is now in free fall toward the ground, the air filled with a strong wooshing sound as the structure pushes air forcefully through the myriad of bones. The shadow of the tower forms overhead, Ssra and Wick who have not yet pushed across the bridge are drowned in the dim light from above...
Vigo BOT 28-02-2023 20:42

Warr [Wick 11|Ammander 7] -4 28-02-2023 22:35

DM [Griz] BOT 28-02-2023 23:08
Large bones rain down from above, the wooshing sound grows in volume, and as Ssra, Wick and Slade continue to rush across the ravine each of them is forced to dodge the shower of blunt calcium. Ssra and Wick each take the impact of a few bones, one of them almost sending Ssra crashing down to her death in the ravine. Just in time though the group push off and into the southern clearing as the tower crashes to the ground. The shockwaves of the impact send a chilling blast of snow out in all directions, showing them with a powdery white mist. As it settles, the ground is littered with several thousand remains, the tower no longer formed in its tight knit shape but a messy, cascading mound that covers the ground, the occasional skull rolling from the top of piles and disappearing out of view over the cliffs. The clearing goes silent, but for the whipping cold wind that howls through the peaks around them.
Anton BOT 28-02-2023 23:18
Anton collapses into the snow on his back, letting his body cool off. "Why does it always have to be this close to everyone dying? Can't we have some whimpy enemies around here?" He mutters, half to himself, half to no one in particular. The moment his mind gets some rest and the adrenaline calms down the slightest bit, he begins strategizing in his head what he should learn for the next fights. A shopping list starts to form, what new arrows, new potions, new utilities. If you want to survive out here, you have to adapt, overcome... But not right now. He pulls out his trusty flask. "Whiskey anyone? Don't want to freeze to death. Not a heroic way to go."

DM [Griz] BOT 04-05-2023 23:15
The afternoon is a flat one, the mist hangs low and thick and the general mood around the town is a little more depressing than its usual... listless average. A group of people, old and young, familiar and not sit in among the quiet tables of the Blood on the Vine. Some of you sit quietly in corners, others prefer the social position of the front bar, chatting with mysterious adventurers. Others, like MacOonnie, tend to find themselves only pushing through the tavern doors for extenuating circumstances. For whatever reason, today you find yourselves serendipitously in positions to overhear a conversation in which two mean speak of local woman Ilda Rowntree, a proud local woman, and mother of three. It appears as though not one, but two of her beloved children have not returned home, nor been seen since yesterday, a very unusual event in its own right, and even moreso given the impending marriage of the eldest brother Justice..
Rabzu BOT 05-05-2023 00:09
Sitting at the bar is a goblin perched on a stool. He is wearing a linen shirt, unstrung so most of his torso is showing, wool pants rolled up to his knees, and a heavy cloak. His ears rotate as he eavesdrops and his clawed hands clutch an ale. Not so subtly, he turns in his chair, staring directly at the men speaking.
Evelyn Scarlet BOT 05-05-2023 01:51
leaning back in her chair in the corner is a human woman twirling a throwing knife in her hand. She has long brown hair, brown eyes, golden jewelry, and a dress‚Ä¶ a dress as red as blood. She stares at the knife with an emotionless gaze, just watching the sharp edges twirl around, but she listens in to the conversation she hears, raising one eyebrow.
Pax BOT 05-05-2023 08:31

Makayla BOT 05-05-2023 08:44

1
MacOonnie BOT 05-05-2023 13:22
Mac stops and turns back around slightly to retrace the few steps to the inn, looking at Mina he takes a deep breath... or rather doesn't, he hasn't needed to do that in centuries, but he steadies himself and opens the door, scanning the room with Mina. "Excuse me, would you mind if I came in?" he addresses the tavern in general, no one in particular but looks towards the two men who Mina identifies telepathically as those having the conversation, "I would like to help," he addresses more to them, still stood in the door, waiting for an invitation into the premises... he ignores the smell of cooked food that is strong in the air as much as he can although it really turns his undead stomach.
Evelyn Scarlet BOT 05-05-2023 13:28

MacOonnie BOT 05-05-2023 14:59
Mac nods at the woman and steps in, approaching the two men, although not getting too close, not wanting to appear threatening. He smiles, trying to keep his fangs covered but as always, the tips peak out slightly; his natural fangs elongated by his vampirism. "Missing anyone is never good, and we do not always have the resources or ability to find them, but I would offer help to try, this place is hopeless enough already."
Rabzu BOT 05-05-2023 17:46

DM [Griz] BOT 09-05-2023 04:05
The group of adventurer'sthe brisk late afternoon fog of the Barovian streets. The group of adventurers step out from the soft comfort of the tavern and into the brisk, biting cold of Barovia. The streets are their usual sullen dilapidated selves, the buildings perpetually on the brink of collapse. The wind howls through the empty alleyways, the sound echoing off the walls as you walk. You all make your way down the main street, huddling together. The men from the bar had given you the directions, and less than 10 minutes later, you arrive at a neat white picket fenced home. It stands out from the other buildings in the area that you have seen, as although still run down, it is beautifully kept, well painted, and clearly cared for. The most peculiar thing about the house is the raised beds in the front, each one containing small, delicate flowers that grow despite the harsh surroundings of the land you now call home. The colours of the flowers provide a small ray of hope, something that takes you a little by surprise in its effectiveness, in an otherwise bleak environment. Approaching the house, you all notice the green front door with a lovely brass knocker. Exchange looks, silently acknowledging the contrast between the inviting door and the desolate surroundings, you now stand at the Stoop of the home of Ilda Rowntree.
Rabzu BOT 09-05-2023 04:10
Rabzu looks up at his companions, his gaze drifting from one to the other. Quickly, he pulls up the hood of his cloak. ‚ÄúOne of you should do the talking.‚Äù His attention then shifts to the flowers - in hopes of recognizing any with toxic properties.
MacOonnie BOT 09-05-2023 05:43
He looks at the house in amazement and awe. This is what he had hoped to see when he came to Barovia, small acts of rebellion like this against the tirades of hopelessness that Strahd had not stopped sending in the direction of the people here for centuries. Mac smiles broadly, the resilience of the living never ceased to cheer him, and it was something he had seen much less of in Barovia than he had hoped. Just this small patch of land was an act of rebellion in and of itself. Cultivating life in a land that rejected it so profusely, twisted and mutilated it until it hardly resembled a life at all. Even undeath didn't have to be this way, Mac wanted to be proof of that himself, it was why his lord had sent him here... "It has been centuries since I have stopped to smell the flowers... mostly because my sense of smell has been rather muted for the majority of that time, but you know what I say? Let's live a little, eh? It's the least we can do." He walks up to one of the plants, saying as he goes, "This woman is truly something, the likes of which are all too rare in these parts, we must do everything in our power to help her!"
2
Makayla BOT 09-05-2023 05:52
‚ÄúThis is all very charming, you‚Äôre absolutely right. It reminds me of the garden of a friend of mine. Well, I say friend, really I mean evil old woman who liked to entice pretty men into her house, curse them, and then make them work her garden for her. But she really did keep a lovely garden, so who could blame her. Also, Ge√∂g was a real delight to behold, so you could understand why she wanted him.‚Äù Makayla sighed ‚ÄúIt was never quite the same after I liberated him and burnt her house down. It‚Äôs a desolate kind of place now‚Ä¶ or at least, it was last time I saw it. Still, nothing like this place. I‚Äôm sure this woman is a delight and not at all an evil witch hell bent on growing beautiful flowers in exact disproportion to the suffering she causes. Shall we say hello?‚Äù
DM [Griz] BOT 09-05-2023 06:29
As you chat and appreciate the simplicity of beautiful blooms the front door the the house suddenly bursts open. Standing in the doorway is a rough but beautiful middle-aged woman, she has long, curled, black hair, green eyes and tanned skin. Her face looks somewhat twisted and panicked, a stark contrast to the lines that clearly indicate a life of smiles, not so much of frowns. "Justice!? Is that you!?" Panic in her voice, she looks out and takes a second to adjust to the fact that there are 4 strange people standing in her garden, and one large lion bent over smelling her flowers... "oh... no. Who are you people?"
Rabzu BOT 09-05-2023 06:40
‚ÄùHello, Ilda. Pretty flowers.‚Äù The goblin says as he slowly begins to approach the woman, his yellow eyes peeking out from under the hood of his cloak. ‚ÄúWe were at the tavern. Heard people talking. Your children are missing, yes?‚Äù He looks back at the group before returning his gaze to the woman, a toothy grin on his face. ‚ÄúWe‚Ä¶can help. What can you tell us about them?‚Äù
Evelyn Scarlet BOT 09-05-2023 11:19
‚ÄúYes, we just want to help, I have two little sisters who I raised myself and I would beside myself if anything happened to either of them.‚Äù the tall woman speaks up with a kind smile, giving the mother a look of sympathy
Pax BOT 09-05-2023 13:23
Pax follows the others a little behind, watching for danger in the foggy dilapidated streets. While the rest seem to find joy in the splash of colour and life in this house, Pax becomes cautious and wary. In his experience such stark differences in living standards often mean one thing, collaborator, though the words used for such people were rarely that kind. Wary but not sure, he kept his mouth closed and his eyes open.
Makayla BOT 10-05-2023 06:42
Slipping forwards, the slight figure of Makayla comes to the woman and rests a hand on her shoulder. ‚ÄúWe heard about this distressing situation and wanted to help in anyway we could. I‚Äôm sure your sons are safe, but it wouldn‚Äôt hurt for us to seek them out to be certain. So, how about I make us all a cup of tea and you tell is everything you know about their disappearance. You then have my word that we will do all we can to return them to you safe and sound.‚Äù
DM [Griz] BOT 10-05-2023 19:06
Her face softens slightly at the mention of help, and of tea. "Oh, aren't you a darling.... That's wonderful... but surely I can make *you* the tea, given you've come to help. Please, do come in..." She steps back from the door into the entrance and moves aside to let you all through. Leading you inside the turns through the door immediately to the right of the front door into what appears to be a modest living room space. She smiles at everyone, gestures to the well loved leather armchairs that sit around the room and lit fire, and begins to scurry off to the kitchen, speaking loudly over her shoulder a she goes. "How will everyone have their tea?" The sound of clanking cups and teaspoons echoes from the next room. To look around the living room, the pride seen outside the house extends inside also. Beautiful mahogany furniture and cabinetry decorate the room, along with a well kept fireplace and ornate rugs across the floor. One of the walls is covered in various family photos, sometimes just one person, but mostly happy family photos amid dreary landscapes. She returns a minute later, not having waited for responses on how tea would be appreciated, with a tray carrying tea cups and a few tea pots. She hands them to the group, then gets herself a cup, pours a tea, and pulls a small flask from between her breasts, tipping some of the contents into the tea. She looks at you and gives a sheepish smile. "A little bit going on y'know? Helps with m'nerves... So, you heard then about my boys? Do you have news?" She sits back into one of the leather chairs, cup on her lap.
Rabzu BOT 10-05-2023 20:27
Grasping a tea cup in his claws, Rabzu walks to the wall covered in pictures. ‚ÄúNo news. Came here first to ask about them. What do they usually do? Places they go? Can they fight?‚Äù He slurps loudly as he takes a sip of tea, staring up at the family pictures. Raising a hand, he points at one. ‚ÄúIs this them? All you can tell us will help us help you, Ilda.‚Äù (edited)
Evelyn Scarlet BOT 10-05-2023 21:33

When I was younger my mother and father died in a horrible accident, I was left to raise my sisters alone and if anything ever happened to them I don‚Äôt know what I would do.‚Äù Evelyn places a hand over the woman‚Äôs ‚ÄúPlease if there is anything we can do to help let us know.‚Äù
Makayla BOT 10-05-2023 23:17

MacOonnie BOT 10-05-2023 23:44
As the tea comes in and is set in the table, Mac leans back as far as he can in the chair furthest away, trying to make it clear that he certainly does not want any of the rancid stuff... or was he the rancid one? Pax BOT 11-05-2023 21:38

DM [Griz] BOT 12-05-2023 00:51
She nods to Rabzu "My eldest boy Justice, he's a great fighter. He has done lots of work in helping defend our home, and our town, he's respected even among the guards of Vallaki!" Something's not right, I can *feel* it.." She takes a sip of her tea, she shakes just a little as she does "...yes, Janshai of course. He is my middle son. He's a good boy, a little misunderstood at times. I imagine he's probably down at the town library, he's always kept to himself, but he has been more moody than usual lately. And of course there's Yvette too, Justice's fiancee. They're due to wed next month you know?" Her eyes light up and you can see soft tears well in them. "Beautiful soul she has. The two of them have done so much for Doran over the last few years, I think Doran loves her almost as much as he does me!" She chuckles, a smile across her face for the first time since you arrived.

DM [Griz] BOT 12-05-2023 02:14
Her demeanour shifts a little as the group of "helpful adventurers" seem to have quickly turned into an antagonising, sharp presence in her home. "Yvette lives across town with her parents, the Findlespar's. They are a lovely couple, and have raised a beautiful gem of a girl in this oppressive landscape." She watches Rabzu push to the edges of the room, and shifts in her seat, feeling a little unconfortable. "Aye, Justice and Doran do, technically Janshai does too but he rarely comes home these days. She takes another sip of the tea. "Doran... he's my beautiful soft boy. He will probably live here forever, I know he is worried about Justice leaving. Gods love him, we all do, but he has it tough sometimes, I wish I could help more. Justice and Yvette though? they so often will spend the day down at the lake all together, they've done that since they were little kids! They are all good boys."

DM [Griz] BOT 15-05-2023 03:52
The group of adventurers make their way through the misty streets of Barovia, the walk exhibiting the usual diverse and eclectic mix of individuals that seem to frequent the downtrodden village As you walk, you chat amongst yourselves, discussing the boys, Yvette, and Ilda, speculating about what new information may reveal itself at the girls house. Despite the seriousness of your mission, there is an air of camaraderie and good humor amongst you all, perhaps its the weather, perhaps its the change of pace to the usual unpleasantries that fill your days. Whatever the reason, a lightness walks with you today. You arrive at the Findlespar residence, taking a moment to survey the building. It is not as grand as Ilda Rowntree's home, but it has a certain charm and character that suggests it has been well-loved and cared for regardless. Together you approach the door, ready to continue your investigation and to face whatever challenges lie ahead.

Makayla BOT 19-05-2023 22:12

DM [Griz] BOT 19-05-2023 22:42
Mina slips by the upset woman and follows the man into the house. He walks up the stairs and out of view with Mina softly floating behind him. Meanwhile Makayla successfully picks the back door and cautiously opens the door. Mina Mina silently follows the flustered father as he ascends the stairs of their modest yet tidy home. The plush orange carpet cushions the mans steps, muffling any sound they might make. The interior of the house exudes a rustic charm with its abundance of carved wood. As they move up the stairwell, Mina notices the simple sketches and portraits of the family members engaged in various sport activities, sitting together, a small watercolour of who the bat recognises is Justice lying at the lake. These framed moments capture moments of a simple, and well lived life as a family, reflecting the love and happiness that manages to fill this household. The father leads the way into the second room on the left, and Mina deftly maneuvers through the doorway, avoiding any accidental collisions. The room is painted a soft sage green, and pinned to the walls are several pieces of art, now clear these, and those up the hall, are the work of Yvette. He searches through a collection of books scattered across the timber desk next to Yvette's bed where he finds a leatherbound journal, tightly wrapped with a long string of leather. As the man turns to leave, Mina quickly shifts out of his way to avoid being accidentally brushed against. With the journal in hand, he descends the stairs and heads back to the front door.
DM [Griz] BOT 19-05-2023 22:43
Makayla Makayla enters the rear door of the house with practiced ease, its lock simple, like most things in Barovia. As the door swings open, Makayla steps into the kitchen, greeted by a scene of cleanliness and tidiness. The air is filled with the delightful aroma of rabbit stew and a medley of spices. As she sweeps across the room, her eyes come to rest on a figure seated at the dining table towards the left end of the kitchen. There, a child of about ten years old sits wide-eyed, a spoon suspended halfway to their mouth. They watch Makayla for a moment, before they call out As the man returns down the stairwell to the door, he has the leatherbound book in his hand. He opens his mouth to speak when everyone hears. Makayla BOT 19-05-2023 23:07

DM [Griz] BOT 20-05-2023 08:23

The woman's face is hard, terrified, mad. The husband stands by her side with shoulders up and clenched fists. DM [Griz] BOT 20-05-2023 20:21

DM [Griz] BOT 20-05-2023 21:56
The air in the room chills as the tension grows. Upstairs, Mina begins rummaging through the desk and around the edge of the bed, looking for anything hidden or obscured.. something just for Yvette. After 30 seconds of searching, and hearing the commotion down below, the little sprite turns up nothing of much interest at all. Several visual journals, art supplies, some normal clothing, pictures of her and Justice. Meanwhile the woman down stairs cocks the weapon a second time, still pointed at Makayla's face "You ALL need to leave our home, *right now*." The father, standing behind her turns so their backs are pressed against one another, from the liquor cabinet by his side he takes a half drunk bottle of whiskey and smahes the base of it against the cabinet, shattering it and producing a glassy sharp instrument, which they now point at Razbu and Pax
Makayla BOT 20-05-2023 23:11
*Makayla screams and runs from the kitchen, pulling open the door and running out. The moment she‚Äôs out of sight of the door, her features blur and the familiar form of the half-elf emerge. With deft speed, Makayla removes the cloak and holds it as if they‚Äôve just grabbed it off someone.* ‚ÄúHey! DM [Griz] BOT 22-05-2023 04:02

MacOonnie BOT 22-05-2023 05:07
Mac sighs, and says to Makayla "You know when a herd panics or starts to stampede, or one sheep does something and they all follow? There isn't really that much difference. Such short lives you mortals, so quick to panic or make connections where there are none, you lose sight of the bigger picture sometimes." He waits a few minutes and knocks on the front door again, "Sorry yes but I doubt your bullets will do too much to me, sorry, don't act brashly and endanger the safe return of your daughter. Please listen to me. You daughter is missing. You live in Barovia. The harsh, unyielding horror that is Barovia I'm sure I don't need to be the one to remind you of thatone. You daughter is missing. Do you think anyone else is going to do anything to help you? Ismark the lesser? We are offering to help, the only ones who will. The harsh reality is that if she is not already dead, brains picked out by some mindless zombie or worse tortured by something less mindless, then time is of the utmost essence and we need to find her as quickly as possible. The journal might help. Are you really going to let your blind panic be another barrier between you and her?"
DM [Griz] BOT 22-05-2023 05:13

DM [Griz] BOT 22-05-2023 05:20
Left to push on to the library to see if anything comes from Janshai, the group walk in silence. The night is now fully set in, and one has to wonder whether the man would even be there now. The energy that had sat with them earlier in the day now somewhat heavier after the series of misunderstandings with Yvette's parents. Niggling questions remain in the backs of their minds, having potentially planted themselves as suspects in this mystery to one substantial half of the affected victims. Regardless, none of that was fixable now, and so the collection of adventurers continue down toward the main town streets and toward the "library" for lack of a better word. When they arrive, from out of one of the windows a soft yellow glow of a lantern dances through the thick mist that slicks around the window at the front. Looking in a young man can be seen at a desk, reading in its light.

DM [Griz] BOT 09-07-2023 23:54
The evening was bitter cold, the barren land gripped by the unforgiving embrace of winter, as if Barovia were not already unpleasant enough. Sleet comes in sharp hard waves, descending across the town at a 45-degrees, fuelled by icy gusts of wind that cut to the bone. Each icy needle stings the skin of any brave enough to venture into the quickly muddied streets, a brown and grey slush slowly growing in the gutter and corners of the dilapidated homes of Barovia. Whether seeking refuge from the harsh elements outside, or here for their own personal pursuits, conversations, or curiosity, the Librium Arcanum found itself host to a collection of Adventurer's this evening. Casually spread across comfortable chairs, or seated by the soft crackling fire with hypnotic, dancing flames, each of you are cast in a soft orange glow as you listen to the torrential downpour outside. The air was thick with the comforting aroma of mulled wine, a fresh brew slowly simmering away in small cauldron by the front of the building. For those of you who sip at a glass, the sensation is fulfilling, a much needed boost to morale as you endure yet another evening.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 10-07-2023 00:07
A young man with striking white hair stands in a corner, browsing the books on the shelves in front of him. He would be considered attractive by most, but there was something about him that made him less approachable than others. His attire doesn't portray anything unusual; a normal studded leather under a cloak. It is dry, which suggests he's been here for a while already. A slightly glowing shortsword is sheathed at his belt, and a beautifully crafted bow that resembles the wing of a dragon at each extremity is held on his back by a little strap. A keen observer would notice that it does not have a bowstring. Nor does the man seem to have any arrows. He looks absorbed in his endeavor, whatever it might be, but something about his demeanor indicates that he is very aware of his surroundings.
Alnak-nik BOT 10-07-2023 00:21
In the warmly lit corner of the Librium Arcanum, nestled amidst an ocean of tomes and parchments, sat the towering figure of Alnak-Nik. As though each swirling snowflake and gust of freezing wind outside further drew the Thri-Kreen into the realm of written word, Alnak-Nik was engrossed in an array of scrolls sprawled across a massive desk that barely contained its alien stature. The Thri-Kreen's multifaceted eyes scanned the content of the open Eldritch tome before it, the reflected orange hues of the crackling fire lending a surrealistic glow to its exoskeleton. Its lower arms were busily engaged in the delicate process of handling the quill, the alien creature's touch surprisingly gentle as it inscribed unfamiliar symbols onto the parchment with an expert precision. From the shadowy corners of the room, a fluttering sound punctuated the quiet ambience. Batty, Alnak's bat familiar, emerged carrying a new bundle of scrolls in its small claws. It swooped over to Alnak, releasing its burden onto a clear section of the desk. With a polite nod of its head, it took flight once again, disappearing back into the darkness, on a constant mission of assisting its master. Amidst the icy onslaught outside, the quietude of Alnak-Nik's corner provided a contrast, a sanctum of tranquility, where the only noises that dared intrude were the soft scratching of the quill, the rustle of parchment, and the occasional hushed flutter of tiny wings.
Scrihk BOT 10-07-2023 01:19
Across the corridor from Alnak's poised scholarship there unfolds quite a different scene of study. "No, dammit - I said get me the Chronicles of R'halus'vae - these are the the Archives! Big difference! Stupid construct! And you, what do I pay you for if you can't even cross-reference the novel claims of a single alchemical treatise. Bah! Have to do everything myself!" This nook is a whirl of activity as homunculus, bat, and unseen servant flit back and forth, ferrying scrolls and tomes to the ratfolk hunched over a stool being used as a makeshift table. Scrihk scribbles wildly on every blank surface he can find, and one point even resorting to notetaking on the wood of a nearby bookshelf. His manic research has a singular goal - to understand the exact nature of Saint Andral's miraculous doings, thereby to better harness whatever divine power remained in the bones fragments he had acquired. If Strahd wanted them so badly, there must be something important about them, and Scrihk was determined to find out what. A loud growl from his stomach momentarily interrupts Scrihk's research, and he looks up to note with surprise that it is already dark outside - in his obsession he had lost track of time. He does spy a familiar face in the Librium, though. "Oh, hey, Knick-knack - didn't see you there. Eat any orphans lately? Haha, just kidding!" ...I hope
1
DM [Griz] BOT 10-07-2023 02:36
As each of you sits quietly, going about your evening the warms if the room is momentarily disturbed as the front door opens, the icy wind pushing it's way into the space and causing the various lanterns around the room to flicker and sputter. A man walks in, closing the door behind him. His features are long, sharp and pointy. His complexion a little darker than others you have seen before who bear the telltale pointed ears of an elf. His hair is slicked back, the black greasy threads shine softly in the ambient light as he steps forward, the well polished shoes that adown his feet making sharp clacking sounds on the old floorboards. Pausing a few steps into the building his face curls into a rather unpleasant smile, his thin lips basically vanishing from his face as gleaming white teeth replace them. With an slender hand he brushes the lapel of his embroidered coat, and speaks while looking down.
Rahadin [NPC] BOT 10-07-2023 02:38
"Ah, a busy little gathering tonight I see. Well, I am sorry but you all shall need to be on your way." He looks back up to those sitting around the room, a flash of red streaks through his iris
Yuki Northernfur BOT 10-07-2023 03:10
Yuki moves his upper body in a way that would let only his head peek around the bookshelf to look at the person exclaiming such preposterous demands. His facial expression, for those who would see it, exudes an air that would best fit someone thinking along the lines of: "Who the hell is that, and why do they think they have the right to boss everyone around?!" Not recognizing the figure at all, he will then look at the reactions of the people around him. Are they hurriedly scattering out the library? Or are they, as he is himself, wondering who that buffoon is?
Ares BOT 10-07-2023 04:06
_Before the man had come in, Ares had been sitting alone, away from the other dwellers of the library. She had entered the place to get away from the cold, but the quiet of the building was a nice enough change of pace that she wanted to take advantage. In her hand is a lit smoke-stick that she takes a drag off of every once in a while, entirely uncaring of the indoor, very flammable environment she's in. On the table in front of her is a manual detailing different combat techniques for larger weapons. The once-proud warrior had trained in many of these techniques years ago, but that was a different time, basically a different person. Now she reads it out of boredom and some interest. A spectral arm fills in the lack of one on her left side when she needs to turn the page. Apparently whatever entity decides when that arm is necessary has decided that a library isn't the best place to put a cigarette down in. How helpful._ _Her eyes flick over the the ratfolk and his menagerie every once in a while, mostly whenever the man scolds his minions. Not out of annoyance, but in the way you do whenever something moves in the corner of your eye._ _When the elf enters and makes his announcement, Ares grunts, sighs, and shrugs. She seems used to this kind of thing. The man is well-dressed, better than most she‚Äôs seen actually. So she assumes he must be the owner, or some other person in power. She starts to turn and rise from her seat, herself looking around at everyone else to see if they might recognize who this is._ (edited)
Alnak-nik BOT 10-07-2023 11:00
(To Scrihk) "Your jests continue to amuse, Scrihk. Perhaps later I shall share some exotic dishes I've discovered. No orphans, I assure you." Alnak-Nik then turns back to its scrolls, the soft scratching of the quill resuming its rhythm. Despite the distraction, Alnak-Nik acknowledges Scrihk's presence, a familiar fixture in its otherwise often solitary existence. As the elf, Rahadin, entered the room and declared his command, Alnak-Nik halted its writing. Its four arms paused over the parchment, the quill in its hand hovering just a hair's breadth above the inked words. The Thri-Kreen's multi-faceted eyes, reflecting the warm firelight, moved towards the source of the disturbance. Alnak-Nik gave Rahadin a curious look, its form as stoic and unreadable as ever. There was a fleeting pause before it resumed its work, making it clear that it had no intention of leaving its comfortable spot unless a very compelling reason was provided. "One does not simply command an end to the pursuit of knowledge," Alnak-Nik telepathically conveyed, its words laced with a faint undertone of disdain, reaching out to all present in the room. It was not an openly defiant act, but rather an insistence on the importance of its task, a refusal to be bullied out of its comfort zone by a stranger's command. (edited)
Scrihk BOT 10-07-2023 11:39
Scrihk chuckles, not recognizing the elf‚Äôs true status or the implied threat it poses. ‚ÄúHaha, good one! I mean have you seen that storm out there? Brrr, no thank you! It‚Äôs ok fella, we‚Äôve got plenty of space. And some light reading on interplanar thermodynamics, if that‚Äôs your thing.‚Äù He waggles the tome currently in his hand. Scrihk‚Äôs stomach suddenly growls again, reminding him that it has been a looong time since his last bagel. ‚ÄúOh yeah, you don‚Äôt have any extra food, do you? I‚Äôll pay, I mean, we could share. Preferably pastries but I mean, if you don‚Äôt have any it‚Äôs not that big a deal, I‚Äôd be fine with a sandwich, a fish, maybe some stew - oh! You don‚Äôt have any cheese, do you?‚Äù He looks up from his work to stare at Rahadin, hopefully.
Rahadin [NPC] BOT 10-07-2023 22:36
The man's smile shifts downward to a frown, the crease lines in his face finding their comfortable, usual position. "You mistake my words as a request, they are an order. Your little "club" has gone on long enough, your benevolent lord Strahd has allowed you all the luxury of such a space far longer than appropriate, and now sees what I have seen all along. Collusion, quiet whispers, training.. Time's up." He steps forward, boots clinking on the floor once more, "So, again, unless you wish to join the books you appear so eager to stand with in defiance, I would suggest you leave with the grace I bestow upon you... I would very much *prefer* for you to stay, If I were honest." His grin returns as the air around him softly swirls and darkens, as though the light from the ambiant lanterns stuggle to stay bright in his presence. He snaps his fingers and a small flame forms in the palm of his hand, it shudders and wavers eagerly.
GRIÃ∂Z ‚ï† Seron¬≥ ‚ï£ 10-07-2023 22:44
https://www.worldanvil.com/uploads/images/4e9f5757dfd5163becc40393365d19f1.jpg
Alnak-nik BOT 10-07-2023 22:57
Alnak-Nik lifted its eyes from the parchment to meet Rahadin's. Its gaze was unyielding, defiant, despite the elf's intimidating display of arcane prowess. The alien creature set its quill down, its upper arms folding over its chest while the lower two continued to rest on the desk. The swirling flames dancing in Rahadin's hand mirrored in its multifaceted eyes, casting an eerie glow on its chitinous features. In spite of the mounting tension, Alnak-Nik's response was calm and unwavering. (Yuki, Scrihk, Ares) "Should we allow this one to dictate our course of action?" Alnak-Nik's telepathic message echoed in the minds of its companions. It cast another glance at Rahadin, its gaze as cold as the Barovian winter. "Lord Strahd has not bestowed upon you the authority to curtail our pursuit of knowledge. Your words ring hollow and your threats... they hold no weight here." Its tone was even, a stark contrast to the palpable tension in the room. Alnak-Nik leaned back in its chair, a non-verbal challenge against Rahadin's display of force. The Thri-Kreen shifted its gaze, looking down at the parchment before it, its upper arms momentarily unfolding to gesture towards it. When it looked back up at Rahadin, its voice carried a tone of unyielding resolve. "Your Lord Strahd had to resort to charms to bend my will. What makes you believe you will fare any better, Rahadin?" Alnak-Nik's words hung in the air, the tension within the room growing palpable. The Thri-Kreen, however, showed no signs of intimidation or fear. It held its ground, refusing to be dismissed or bullied.
Rahadin [NPC] BOT 10-07-2023 23:13
The man bursts into cold, dry laughter, and trivially wipes a pretend tear away from the corner of his eye. "My, my, what *spark* you have. I just *love* when you little vermin get that spark. All the more pleasurable to extinguish it. You clearly have little knowledge of the kinds of games we play. Power is no fun if all you ever do is push, the joy is in the pull little one, and don't you tug *hard*." Continuing forward, there is a flash of light as the man moves with unnatural speed, so much so even those most perceptive cannot see his motion, only the debris of paper that cascades through the room in his wake. Alnak feels the cold pointed fingers of the man on their shoulders as he now stood behind them. The air around the thri-kreen goes cold, and their mind is filled with a chorus of the most unbearable screams imaginable. Their vision blurs as the cacophony of terrified shrieks and wails overwhelms their senses, pushing them to the brink of their ability to maintain composure and consciousness. The man leans forward, and whispers in their ear. "I love nothing more than the hunt, I do hope you survive the evening so that we can continue this little dance, and I can *truly* show you your place, properly educate you about real suffering. I am an excellent teacher..." He leans back upright, and walks slowly toward the doors of the building.
Alnak-nik BOT 10-07-2023 23:21
As the harsh chorus of screams invaded Alnak-Nik's mind, it tried to maintain its composure. The Thri-Kreen's mandibles chattered slightly, a sign of the intense strain the creature was under. With a swift motion, Alnak-Nik tried to grapple Rahadin, its four arms lashing out in an attempt to seize the man. Yet, Rahadin's speed was not to be underestimated. In the blink of an eye, he slipped out of Alnak-Nik's grasp. The Thri-Kreen's arms clutched at empty air, failing to find purchase on their intended target. Alnak-Nik watched as Rahadin slowly sauntered towards the doors, the grating sound of his laughter echoing within its mind, amplifying the intense discomfort. (edited)
Rahadin [NPC] BOT 10-07-2023 23:25
As the Thrikreen grasps at Rahadin, they swiftly take one of the four hands and pull it in close to their body, barely visible, the dagger slides between the ribcage of Alnak - sharp, deep... It burns. Poison courses through their body as the man removes the dagger in the same smooth fluid motion he pushed it in with. Letting go of their hand Alnak is dropped to the floor, and Rahadin continues towards the door as though nothing had ever happened.
Scrihk BOT 10-07-2023 23:39
The mention of ‚ÄòLord Strahd‚Äô is certainly enough to snap Scrihk‚Äôs attention firmly back to the present - he is entirely uninterested in repeating his close encounter with the dark lord from a few weeks back. Which is why, when Alnak makes his move and is stabbed to the ground in response, Scrihk hesitates - torn between concern for an ally and an overwhelming instinct for self-preservation. ‚Äú<Bug brain!! What are you doing?!?!>‚Äù he demands in an urgent whisper (that Rahadin can surely hear). ‚Äú<Remember what happened to Gan?! Don‚Äôt be an idiot!!!>‚Äù He crouches behind his desk, attention wavering between Alnak‚Äôs condition and Rahadin‚Äôs retreating form.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 10-07-2023 23:56
Yuki has not been in Barovia for very long compared to some others, but he learned that to survive here, it's better to choose your battles. Not knowing the enemy, and having a sense of self-preservation as strong as his animal counter-part, he decides that he better evaluate the situation first. Yuki is not in the library to study or pursuit knowledge as some others seem to be. He's here because of the weather. Any other place would be as fine as this one. He doesn't dislike books, but he doesn't like them enough to die over them. After getting the mental message, he decides to play it safe for now. Although he doesn't want anyone to die, and he would jump in to save a life if it was something he was sure he could do, at the moment he is sure of nothing and knows no one in this library. And so, he slides into the shadows, trying his best to erase his presence from the area, to better observe and act accordingly.
Alnak-nik BOT 11-07-2023 00:13
As the pain from Rahadin's attack courses through Alnak-Nik, a sudden rush of fury and humiliation hits just as hard. It's been tossed aside, in public, with all the grace of swatting a fly. The taste of defeat is bitter and toxic, stirring an instinctive need for vengeance. But in this moment, the thri-kreen has little more than its pride and the fight within. This wasn't a battle to be won with weapons alone. Rahadin's power was something else entirely. Slowly, Alnak-Nik pushes itself from the ground, each movement a scream of protest, but it forces itself to rise. Its eyes dart around the room, gauging the reactions of the others. There's a shared struggle here, a shared defiance. This wasn't a lone fight. Leaning on the nearest table for support, Alnak-Nik finds the strength to speak, its words seething with anger and defiance. (Open Telepathy) "You...haven't won...nothing yet." With one last, pained look at the exit where Rahadin had gone. (edited)
DM [Griz] BOT 11-07-2023 00:22
The pale elf stands at the door, and with the open palm stretched out, he leans forward and blows the soft burning ember that sits softly in its centre. The burning embers flit across the space, catching on various books and furniture around the space. As they take, the embers burst into small flames, the dancing and flickering glow of their quickly growing heat sees the silhouettes of small creatures dancing deep in the flames. "One thing you should know about me... I always win." He turns, laughing, and walks from the building, closing the door behind him. There is a dull thunk of metal from outside which is quickly overshadowed by the crackling of several fires around you all,

Yuki Northernfur BOT 11-07-2023 03:52
As things were rapidly leaning into "dicey" territory, Yuki is glad to have found a great little spot in the shadows from which to look at the scene unfold.
