Rat-Ares12|Madeline10|Caria4 EST 11-07-2023 04:44
Ph ares tries to kill fire
Alnak-nik BOT 11-07-2023 11:14
Summoning every ounce of willpower, Alnak-Nik reaches for a vial from the Alchemist's potion belt, uncorks it, and takes a deep swig of the Greater Healing Potion. A soothing warmth spreads throughout its body, dulling the pain and mending the wound inflicted by Rahadin. Feeling a surge of strength returning to it, Alnak-Nik then focuses on its spellcasting, a veil of frost forming around its exoskeleton as it casts Armor of Agathys. The cold emanating from the frost armor counters the heat from the flames, and it finds itself more resilient against the fire. Its companion, Batty, swoops toward Yuki, fluttering by his side. The tiny creature looks up at the half-elf, ready to assist in any way it can to fight the fire imp.
DM [Griz] BOT 11-07-2023 13:30
Chaos breaks out as the embers quickly turn from small glowing flecks of orange into active flames. The large summoned fire demon in the centre of the room unhinges its jaw, air sucks into the maw at an astonishing rate, it drags more embers around the room toward it before the glow that hummed deep in its bowels illuminates into a blindingly bright amber glow. Flames erupt from it and send a wall of fire out in all directions around it. Bookshelves catch fire, everything burns. The floor, the books, the ceiling, all engulfed. Everyone, including the creatures that hide as black silhouettes in smaller flames, are thrown with the extreme force of the heat into the walls and furniture around them. It is only with some quick movement and magical assistance that several of the party manage to stay conscious from the immense blast. The blast is so catastrophic the oxygen begins to be sucked out of the air around you. To the north of the room, several of the firey creatures absorb the wall of flame, and in turn grow in size themselves, their flames licking up the walls as they cross over and between one another, and begin to surround Ares. The tiny darting imps skirt across the blazing floor and spew more fire across the space. All that you know in this moment is heat, an overwhelming heat unlike anything ever experienced before. Within seconds the Librium arcanum has transformed into an undulating vacuum chamber of flame and smoke, the roar of the fire screams with a ferociousness none of you ever could have expected. In the centre of the room the fire demon spins on its axis, a massive glowing grin across its face is it revels in the catastrophic destruction that unfolds around it.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 11-07-2023 14:08
Yuki can barely hold his breath and not make a sound as all hell breaks loose around him. Creature A antagonizing Creature B, Creatures C to E popping out of nowhere, fire spreading in every corner... explosions! What is going on!! His survival instinct kicks in, now more scared than anything. He starts shifting; his white hair growing on his head, on his face and down his neck, his nose elongating into a snout, black lines circling his eyes and mouth, and a puffy tail of pure, very soft-looking white, springs out of his trousers. His arctic fox shift is great in snowy mountains, but in a burning building? Not so sure... Regardless, he pulls out his bow and, from his hiding spot, aims at the closest fire imp. His fingers pinch the air where the non-existent bowstring would be. And from his fingers, heading both up and down at the same time towards the bow's extremities, a golden light traces the shape of a straight line, creating the bowstring. And at the same time, a thick arrow of light is created the same way as Yuki pulls back on the bowstring made of light. He lets it go, the arrow headed rapidly towards the imp. It hits it, true to Yuki's aim, before exploding in tiny sparks of golden light. The imp seems to have felt that, a chunk of its body gone with the explosion. Yuki quickly moves towards the door at the far south, his goal being to try and see how it can be opened. His fox shape allows him to cover a lot in a few bounds. A perceptive folk could probably see tiny patches of ice being created where his paws touch the ground, but under such heat, they seem even smaller and quicker to evaporate than usual. Near the door, he turns to look at what the others are doing, ready to shoot if need be. (edited)
Scrihk BOT 11-07-2023 14:37
Scrihk is able to duck behind his makeshift stool/desk just in time to escape the blast, and somehow has the presence of mind to fling an ice bomb just ahead of Sanver, interposing a cocoon of cold air just in time to attenuate the full force of the explosion. His own underlings, however, are not so fortunate: bat, homunculus, and unseen servant all perish instantly in the massive outburst of flame and heat. Scrambling quickly to his feet, Scrihk unstoppers a healing potion and hastily downs it, but his hands are shaking so much that most of it spills out on the grown, mitigating the healing potency. There's no time - it'll have to do. Bending down, he retrieves Hunk's clockwork arm upon which there is grafted an arcane cannon. The flaming Librium is suddenly filled with an ear-piercing high frequency whine as the ratfolk clocks the weapon into overdrive. "DAMMIT! Do you have any idea how long it took me to recalibrate the anterior dorsal gyro after the LAST time Hunk exploded? Burn in he-!! wait, nevermind... Yaaaaaahhhh!!!" A massive beam of energy erupts from the cannon before splitting into nine smaller missiles, streaking through the air and slicing all five imps up into ribbons of pain and smoke.

DM [Griz] BOT 11-07-2023 19:42
As Scrihk sends the tiny devils back to where they came, each one bursts in a chain reaction of flame. one after another they each spew out an arc of firey debris, the heat increases, the smoke begins to billow in the roof cavity, and the raging fire continues to consume the building...
Ares BOT 11-07-2023 19:47
_Too much, too fast. Ares had moved to fight the fire, quite literally, and she got a few swings in before explosion after explosion after explosion rocks her world. She roars in pain as her clothes catch fire, but at this point she doesn‚Äôt care. Her main goal is to get out. She begins to run toward the goal, uncaring about whatever creatures might still be alive._
Alnak-nik BOT 11-07-2023 22:16
Alnak-Nik shudders as each fiery explosion assaults its senses and burns away the frosty protective barrier. The heat of the inferno makes it challenging to think clearly, but Alnak-Nik isn't willing to give up just yet. Despite the chaos, Alnak-Nik senses the absence of Batty, and a flicker of sadness sparks within. But there isn't time to mourn; its own survival, and the survival of the others, are now the priority. Summoning its remaining energy, Alnak-Nik reaches out telepathically to the remaining party members in the building, the urgency of the situation reflected in the intensity of its mental voice. (All Except Hostiles) "Everyone, converge on my position. I can shape the stone to create an exit. We must move quickly to escape this inferno!" Its antennae flicking in concentration, Alnak-Nik starts to focus on its next spell, waiting for the others to gather near before creating a life-saving doorway in the stone wall.
Alnak-nik BOT 12-07-2023 01:01
Even as the blaze intensifies around it, Alnak-Nik refuses to falter. It quickly secures another greater healing potion from its potion belt, uncorking it and downing the contents with an urgency born from the dire situation. The potion's effects are immediate and soothing, dulling the pain from the fiery onslaught and revitalizing its energy. With a newfound vigor, Alnak-Nik strides to the wall, placing all four of its hands upon the solid stone. It closes its eyes, concentrating deeply as it channels the energies of the Stone Shape spell. The air vibrates with latent energy as the Thri-kreen's hands begin to move, mimicking the action of opening a great door. Under its touch, the seemingly impenetrable stone yields, warping and reshaping like clay under a sculptor's hand. With a final push, Alnak-Nik forms a large opening in the wall, creating an unexpected exit amidst the engulfing flames. (All Non Hostiles) "Hurry! This way!" The telepathic command is strong and clear as it resonates in the minds of the party members. With one final glance back at the burning library, Alnak-Nik swiftly moves through the opening it had created, leading the way to safety.
DM [Griz] BOT 12-07-2023 01:11
The demonic abomination lumbers forward, the flames it leaves in its wake are trivial now as the entire space around it is engulfed in blinding inferno. Roof tiles begin to collapse into the space and the smoke starts to truly take hold, pushing downward as the air above is quickly replaced with the thick, unbearable fumes. The small windows that line the front of the building blow out with spectacular force, the glass raining down onto the silent Barovian streets. As they do, air is sucked forcefully into the building, along with the air siphoned in from Alnak's newly formed doorway. The blaze surges. The firey maw of the beast clamps down on Ares, blood not even running from the wounds as they cauterize in an instant. Its long spiney tail whips and slashes, the movement only fanning the flames that surround it even more. The punishing force of which it strikes Scrihk is enough to throw them 10 feet backward across the floor. They throw up their hands and shield some of the firey impact as they slide. Further down the room, as two of the fires are extinguished by a well placed Shatter spell from Sanver, the remaining fire spirit sprints around the space, making good and sure that every last inch of the space is irrevocably alight. Time was running out. The new focus? Get out.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 12-07-2023 01:24
As Yuki is about to try and open the door, or at least find a way to do so, the mental command to go over at an improvised exit resonates in his head. From his point of view, he is unable to see the exit, but a change in light and movements in the flames nearby indicate that there is a high chance there is an opening there now. Worth the risk. Weaving and dodging through flames, smoke, furniture and other obstacles, Yuki quickly beelines for the area where the light changes, since "This way!" from a mental command is very imprecise. The sound is coming from inside one's head after all. He finally arrives at a hole in the wall. The mantis who technically started all this is already out, making it highly probable they are the one responsible for the hole as well. It creates mixed feelings inside Yuki, but the current objective is simply to get out of here.
Sanver BOT 12-07-2023 01:40
Sanver seeing the flames in the back about to sputter out throws out a thunderous wave that hits all the small flames and is able to eliminate two of the three. He then moves towards the exit to escape the heat. He was no fool but of course sometimes you have to take risks when appropriate.
DM [Griz] BOT 12-07-2023 01:43
The group scramble from the blazing building, walls begin to collapse and stones start to explode under the extreme heat and pressure that has turned the Librium Arcanum into a furnace. The beast within can be heard laughing over the roar of the violent fire. Standing in the street you clutch your knees, keeled over as you take deep, panicked breaths. Within the building the creature could be heard thrashing against what walls and pieces of ceiling remained in tact. You look around at each other, a brief moment of reprieve as you prepare for whatever comes next.

Alnak-nik BOT 12-07-2023 03:20
Having navigated the party out of the blazing inferno, Alnak-Nik doesn't allow itself to pause for rest. Instead, it brings out its Rod of the Pact Keeper, a crucial tool that amplifies its connection with the mysterious, otherworldly force it's tied to. As it focuses on the rod, a rush of energy floods through it, reinstating a pact spell slot that had been spent. In tandem, Alnak-Nik harnesses the power of its Elemental Gift. The air around it starts to shimmer, as if reacting to the call of the elemental magic. In a matter of moments, it is lifted off the ground, soaring upward as the magic gives it the power of flight. From a height of 30 feet, Alnak-Nik surveys the scene. The vantage point allows it to observe the surroundings clearly, the full extent of the calamity unfolding below now visible to its keen eyes.
DM [Griz] BOT 12-07-2023 04:34
The ground shakes as the building implodes. Debris, dust, smoke, and fire all spew out into the Barovian evening air. The buildings around the space now dance with the yellow and orange lightshow that is mirrored in everyone's eyes, the heat bordering on unbearable now. There is a rumble that is present alongside the return of the demonic cackle, deep and earthshaking. From within the blazing fire the summoned elemental demon stands up straight. Fuelled by the flames the beast is now easily 30ft wide, consuming most of the building within the flames that form part of its lower half. It raises fists high in the air and lets out a shattering roar, filled with satisfaction and joy of the utter chaos that befalls it.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 12-07-2023 23:39

Running further away from the threat to avoid further flames, he takes his bow out. The bowstring made of light appears once again as he pinches the air, and arrow equally made of light magically appearing between his fingers. Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 13-07-2023 19:36
With the chilling void of the cosmos fresh in its mind, Alnak-Nik channels its energy, casting the spell Hunger of Hadar. A 20-foot-radius sphere of blackness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point above the colossal fire demon. This void is filled with a cacophony of soft whispers and slurping noises that can be heard up to 30 feet away. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures fully within the area are blinded. As this spell unfolds, the massive fiery figure disappears within the darkness, consumed by the chilling void. The spectacle of cosmic energy dominates the sky, casting an eerie sight against the backdrop of the burning library and the carnery. Fueled by adrenaline, Alnak-Nik uses its Elemental Gift to fly higher, creating distance between itself and the chaotic scene below. It rises through the night, keen to gain a vantage point to observe the unfolding situation.
DM [Griz] BOT 13-07-2023 22:37
The Demon is plunged into a sphere of unrelenting darkness. The flames surge around the outside of the ball, pushed from within by the gripping cold of Alnak's magic. They lick up and around the exterior forming a cocoon of fire that crackles and spits at the threshold between two opposing forces. From within the sphere three rods of molten hot lava stream out, waving around in the air like a searchlight that hunts its target. Alnak deftly evades the one that zigzags through the sky, the remaining two drag along the cobblestone surface below and find their target, one slicing through the shoulder of Ares, the other through the leg of Scrihk - some quick thinking sees the rat shield themselves from most of the harm, and cling to consciousness once more. Fully obscured from the group, the demon roars once more, it is hard to discern whether it is pleased or frustrated with its new dwelling.

Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 14-07-2023 14:11
(To Alnak-Nik) Alnak-Nik, thanks to its Devil's Sight, watches as its eldritch energy pierces through the obscure void created by Hunger of Hadar. Despite the usual inky darkness, to Alnak-Nik, the colossal fire demon is as clear as day. Its blasts strike true, assailing the creature with a flurry of arcane force. With the satisfaction of successful strikes, Alnak-Nik takes advantage of its airborne position and shifts its course southward, the detailed streetscape clearly visible below even in the nighttime darkness. It continues to descend towards street level, keeping a vigilant eye on the demonic beast trapped within its spell. (To Others) With a surge of energy, Alnak-Nik extends its limbs towards the concealed fire demon, launching two beams of crackling energy from its fingertips. Feeling the release of energy against its foe, Alnak-Nik continues to maneuver in the air, flying southwards. Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 15-07-2023 05:23
From Alnak-Nik's perspective, seeing through the darkness that engulfs the fire demon, it stretches all four arms forward, each hand crackling with magical energy. The arcane power pulsates between its fingers, echoing with the rage of the earth, the raw, crushing might of the dao. With a flurry of its arms, two blasts of energy, each accompanied by a deep, ground-shaking rumble, shoot forth. The first strikes the fire demon with such force that it tears through its flaming body. There is a moment of deafening silence, then a thunderous boom as the demon's fiery existence is extinguished, the second blast sailing through the dispersing smoke of its demise. The cold air and the writhing tentacles of the Hunger of Hadar seem to breathe a sigh of relief, their chilly embrace smothering the remaining fire, restoring a semblance of peace in the midst of the chaos. Alnak-Nik descends then, a potion already in its hand, its mind set on aiding its fallen companions. From the perspective of the other party members, it is a sight to behold. From the darkness that swallowed the demon, two intense blasts of force emanate. The first one hits, and the unseen colossal demon and seems to implode, its vibrant, fiery aura snuffed out in an instant. The second blast sails through the dark void. From the dark sphere, the air grows colder, and the once flaming battleground starts to cool down. Then, from the skies, they see Alnak-Nik, the formidable thri-kreen warlock, descending to the ground with an object in its hand, clearly intent on aiding their unconscious companions. (To the party) "The demon has been vanquished, its flames quelled by the cold void. Regroup and let us attend to our fallen. Be on your guard, we have survived but the night is not yet over." (edited)

Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 15-07-2023 05:44
With the potion of healing already in hand, Alnak-Nik quickly crosses the distance to the unconscious Scrihk. The smell of burning and the crackling sound of fire fill the air around them. Unfazed by the chaos, Alnak-Nik uncorks the potion with swift ease. Using its multiple limbs, it gently lifts Scrihk's head, the rat-like features of the humanoid grimacing in pain even in unconsciousness. Alnak-Nik tilts the potion to Scrihk's lips, allowing the life-giving liquid to flow into his mouth. As the healing potion takes effect, the harsh lines of pain on Scrihk's face ease, his breathing stabilizes, and some semblance of life begins to return to his still form.
DM [Griz] BOT 15-07-2023 06:53
Nothing remains of the beast but the raging building fire if the Librium Arcanum. Ares and Scrihk are reatored to consciousness, after kissing the face of death they turned with a gestured "not today death", before the ight returns to their eyes. Without the enormous infero's fiery presence it takes no time at all to douse the flames and restors the square to the usual Barovian grey, just with more grey as the smoldering ruins billow out plumes of thick white and grey ash into the air. Black charred twigs prodrude from the ruins and not a thing is left identifiable in the vicinity except for a singular set of dangling metal chains, warped and stretched front he heat the manicles that had bound the collection of book club spell books were nowhere to be seen. As morning begins to crack a shard of pale light over the horizon, locals and other adventures begin to wearily leave their homes to inspect what the fuss was about from the night before. They look, shrug, and go about their day. Just another shithole squatters house razed into the ever evolving and growing soils of Barovia.
Scrihk BOT 15-07-2023 11:10
Scrihk awakens to find himself clutched in Alnak's many arms, the insectoid's grasping mandibles mere inches from his face, and he knows that he was right all along: Alnak wants to eat him. "Aaeeeiiii!!! No, don't eat m-!!\glug\glug\glug\<cough><cough><cough>" He sputters and gasps as the healing liquid makes its way down his throat, burning his insides in a manner not unlike the flames just moments before. But then, cooling tranquility - ahhhh. Scrihk quickly rolls out of Alnak's grasp and lands on the ground with a thud. "Ow!" Inside his charred, singed satchel he finds his very last unbroken vial of healing serum, and with practiced efficiency of motion he quickly injects Ares with it. As her breathing resumes the battered druggist lets out an enormous sigh of relief before slumping back to the ground, laying on his back and using Ares' leg as a pillow. He takes his goggles off and relishes in the cold night air as he looks up at the sky, still partly obscured by embers and ash. "D-did we win?"
Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 15-07-2023 11:26
Upon seeing Scrihk stir, Alnak-Nik lets out a sigh of relief - a sound not unlike a gust of wind over a dune, the kind of sound one might expect from a being with its unique physiology. It stands back, watching as Scrihk quickly tends to Ares with impressive efficiency, a display of survival and tenacity. (To everyone) "Yes, we won. The demon is gone." Alnak-Nik's mental voice resonates through the minds of everyone present, steady and as unyielding as the stone it manipulates. It watches as Scrihk slumps down onto the ground, seemingly content to lay there. There is no judgement in its myriad eyes, just the silent acknowledgment of a fight well-fought, and a victory well-won.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 15-07-2023 11:56
Yuki's arms lump on his sides, barely able to hold his bow or pull on the string anymore. In the distance, the group of adventurers that had the most to deal with were gathered, fixing themselves up. He slowly walks to where they are near the fountain. Once he gets there, he can see Ares and Scrihk on the floor. And he can't blame them. That thing was huge and out of nowhere. Then he looks at the insectoid. That one he could blame! "You realize that this whole thing could have been avoided, right? The library burning, these two facing death, everyone here getting hurt... Just tell me you do get it and that it's been a learning experience for you. ...was it?" He waits for a reply from the mantis, his own face showing nothing more than controlled anger and contempt.
1
Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 15-07-2023 12:16
(To Yuki) "You dare question my actions? This...unfortunate situation was not of my making. I did what I had to for survival. This 'learning experience', as you call it, is just part of life. You would do well to remember that not all outcomes can be predicted, fox." There's a frosty edge to Alnak-Nik's mental voice as it responds to Yuki's criticism. Its chitinous form, illuminated by the dancing flames, radiates a cold, indifferent pride. The Thri-Kreen's multitude of eyes glint, revealing perhaps a tinge of regret ‚Äì not for the lost lives or the burnt library, but for the personal loss of its Eldritch tome. (edited)
Yuki Northernfur BOT 15-07-2023 12:28
The answer from the insectoid does not ring as satisfactory in Yuki's mind as he hoped it would. He sighs heavily. "This is your doing. You angered someone you failed to read, someone you did not know how powerful they were. You got burnt for it... quite literally. We could have gone out, or discussed, but you antagonized whomever that was. Not sure how, but I the way he reacted tells tales." "None of that was for 'survival'. You played in their hands." "Not all outcomes can be predicted, but most can be mitigated. I don't have to question your actions. They showed me that you are inexperienced and immature. Hopefully that's what you really are, then there is hope for you." Yuki turns around and starts walking away after a quick glance at the adventurers that got the worst of it. They seem out of immediate danger, and so he deems them taken care of. He does, however, remember their faces for when he gets to meet them again.
Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 15-07-2023 12:31
(To Yuki) "Inexperience? Immaturity? Or perhaps simply a different set of priorities, fox. This is not a game, it is a fight for survival in a world that cares not for us. The choice was mine to make, and I stand by it. This... consequence was unforeseen. But we live, we adapt. That is how we survive." Alnak-Nik's psychic voice reverberates with a calm intensity, a clear counterpoint to Yuki's irritation. As the fox-man retreats, the Thri-Kreen remains there, its four arms crossed. It watches Yuki's departure, an inscrutable expression on its insectoid face. At last, it looks towards the burning library once again, a feeling of loss threatening to engulf it. Its Eldritch tome...gone. A necessary sacrifice, it tells itself. As the flames dance, Alnak-Nik mentally reaches out to its patron, Jatuno, a silent plea for a replacement tome. A new day would rise, Alnak-Nik knew. And they would face it... and the next fiery challenge... together.
Sanver BOT 15-07-2023 13:50
Sanver collapses onto the ground coughing up blood and his sword scatters to the floor. He takes a considerable amount of time to get back onto his feet. "I guess you could say that the demon had big problems."
Ares BOT 15-07-2023 13:56
‚ÄúWhat the fuck is even so important about that library to get it burned?‚Äù _Ares asks in exasperation from her spot on the ground, eyes still closed and panting._
Alnak-nik [Jen] BOT 15-07-2023 14:16
(To Sanver, Ares, and the rest of the party) "In that library... were truths and lies of this world and others. Tomes of arcane and divine wisdom. It was a beacon for those who sought knowledge... and power." Alnak-Nik's psychic voice spreads into the minds of the party members, filled with a hint of regret. Its gaze shifts toward the smouldering remains of the once grand library. "Now, it is no more. We have lost, not just a building, but a repository of potential understanding." After a moment of silence, it adds, "As for why it was targeted... that remains unknown. But we should remember, in Barovia, nothing is without reason."
DM [Griz] BOT 15-07-2023 20:29
After some tense words, the group separate, off to recuperate and repair themselves to fight another day. Meanwhile, somewhere within the halls of Castle Ravenloft, Rahadin drops a small collection of intricately decorated books on the desk before Lord Strahd as they sip at a glass of wine. "Wonderful Rahadin. A job well done." ...

GRIÃ∂Z ‚ï† Seron¬≥ ‚ï£ 29-07-2023 14:05
## CONNECTING THE DOTS
PM
2
DM [Griz] BOT 31-07-2023 01:58
A group of familiar adventurers, Lila, Georg, Sacross, Nagrom, and newcomer Cara, find themselves seated around the grand dining table at Castle Ravenloft once more. This unexpected return to the ominous building stirs mixed emotions within them, all plainly aware of the dangers that lurk within its dark walls, and yet somewhat conflicted in their own personal interactions with the lord of the lands. None-the-less, they remain resolute, knowing that their presence was surely a follow up to their last efforts for the vampire mistress. The grand hall was as hauntingly majestic as they remembered. Its towering walls adorned with dark tapestries depicting scenes of forgotten battles, and historical, shadowy figures. A massive chandelier hung low above them, casting flickering shadows upon the polished marble floor and seemingly animating the images that adorn the walls. The dining table was set with small boards of cheese and cured meats, a humble yet inviting feast, with each adventurer accompanied by a glass of wine. Though the meal was simple, it served as a symbol of hospitality and a gesture of good will that seemingly always followed their host... -- You all sit around the table, expressions varied, reflecting own your own thoughts and concerns. The dining hall felt eerily quiet, devoid of any other presence save for you all, and the soft crackling of the fire. You sit in quiet conversation, the anticipation of what lay ahead weighing upon you. Yet, you cannot deny the flicker of hope that lingers within your hearts, for better or worse, these audiences meant standing, and impactful change in the landscape of Barovia, both something well and truly worth its weight in gold in such troublesome times..
4
Georg BOT 31-07-2023 02:22
"Honestly," the dark haired ranger says in a hoarse whisper to Lila, "I'm shocked I was asked back to carry out more work for the Countess." Georg nervously takes another gulp of his wine. "I thought that she would never hire me again after hearing of my blunders that nearly cost us the scouting mission last time!" When Cara arrives, Georg gasps. "Cara! Long time no see!! Hope you've been keeping yourself well."
Lila BOT 31-07-2023 02:25
"I did not mention any blunders to the Countess. I'm not sure anyone else did either. But do be more careful this time." The unspoken "you idiot" lingers at the end of the sentence. "Death-Touched," she says nodding in greeting at Cara. "We meet again. It has been quite some time since our last underground expedition together."
Nagrom Eks BOT 31-07-2023 02:35
Not even aware he is doing it, Nagrom softly sings a song to himself We marched through the dungeons beneath the ground. Although we toiled for Strahd, our hearts were sound. But it is not our deeds of bravery for which we would be renown. Only for being in the service of the crown.
1
2
Sacross BOT 31-07-2023 04:13
Eyes the food on the table. The look of it, especially the cured meats, would have tempted Sacross. Yet the simple pleasure of taste had been lost to him, over a year and a half now. Were his memories of taste even correct? His hand moved to the pipe in his pocket before stopping himself. Generally those partaking of such vitals didn't appreciate the smell of smoke coming from his pipe. Smell, another sense lost to his in his passing. Al least his ears still worked, he gave Nagrom a pleasant grin as he heard the bard's quiet song. A brief retelling of their past exploits for Lady Strahd. Sacross curiously ponders what will come of this dinner. More dark tunnels to explore? One must wait and see.
1
Cara BOT 31-07-2023 04:47
She looks around the room, her eyes hungrily trying to take in each detail. She glaces past the food which is of no interest to her. She looks as she has always looked, perhaps as she always must look. She has a pretty enough face framed by blond hair, she is no great beauty but would pass for the prettiest girl in many a village. Yet she is more pale than fair and her eyes seem older than her face, much older, eyes which have seen too many things. Her well used armor speaks of the grim practicality of staying alive in Barovia but her only weapon is a staff that seems more ornamental than practical. She slides the engraved invitation back into her pocket, then as her eyes see familiar faces she smiles and her expression softens. Still smiling she walked over to sit near the comfortingly familiar forms of Georg and Lila ‚ÄúGeorg , Lila. It has been far too long since I have seen either of you, I‚Äôm glad to see both look well. As for me Georg, Death came close once or twice but she did not take me into her embrace me so I am well thank you for asking. Im still trying to keep people alive, I‚Äôm still not quite always succeeding but I think I am getting a little better at persuading Death to be patient‚Äù She rests her staff against the table and turns to the unfamiliar faces ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Cara, I hope we can get to know each other better. But I think that can wait, let us see what our host has to say first‚Äù

1
Grumpy (crow) BOT 31-07-2023 05:19
The scruffy looking bird hops off Cara‚Äôs shoulder with a brief flap of his wings and alights on the table with the faintest clattering of claws on varnished wood If Cara is disinterested in the food, Grumpy is quite the opposite. The crow has his beady eye on some tasty morsels
1
DM [Griz] BOT 31-07-2023 06:36
As you sit and chat with one another, enjoy the smallgoods and fine wine, the minutes pass. Eventually, the large heavy ornate doors of the dining room swing open, a familiar face standing between them as each is pushed out to the sides - the pale elf Rahadin stands expressionless to one side, hands tucked behind his back. A moment passes, and the familiar sound of echoing heels on hard marble echoes through the room from the corridor beyond, soon, the sound has vision to match as an exquisitely dressed Strahd swans into the dining hall. Her hair is down, something you have not seen before, long thick and shiny loose curls drop around her shoulders and spring slightly as she walks. A long crimson red gown slings to her body and drops heavily to the floor in a long train of gathered velvet behind her. A wide grin is drawn across her face, bright red lips pop against brilliant white teeth. "My DARLINGS... How nice to have you at my table so soon." She glides across the shiny floor to the head of the table, a flick of her finger sends the large, heavy wooden chair back from its position, allowing her to sit, throwing one leg over the other, an elongated black nail positioned between her teeth as she looks around the table with hungry eyes.

DM [Griz] BOT 31-07-2023 06:40
More exposed than you had ever seen previously, it surprises you to see the countess adorned with several tattoos, their jet black ink strongly contrasting against her alabaster skin
Cara BOT 31-07-2023 07:09
She looks up as the doors open, she begins to try to assess Rahadin then as she hears the heels clicking on the marble her perspective shifts. What she is watching is a performance and she calmly, almost appreciatively, watches the performance unfold. She permits herself the slightest of smiles as Strahd enters the room, every inch of her the great beauty that Cara knows that she herself is not. She has a slight pang as she watches each carefully choreographed element of the scene unfold, her sister would have been so much better at this A memory comes, suddenly out of nowhere the memory is there in perfect clarity Two women sit taking tea in a graveyard, neither is alive yet neither can die. The shadows watch and they have teeth The memory is enticing, it is close the The Memory, the one she feels is so important. But this is not the moment for such things. She sets it aside like a dark gem so that she can study every facet of it later. She is here for a purpose and that means she needs her wits about her. The hunger in those eyes was enough to chill the even alchemy that passed for blood in her veins "I am most grateful for the invitation and most impressed at your hospitality"
Georg BOT 31-07-2023 07:54
Georg swallows with an audible gulp as Countess Strahd, The Vision, stuns her audience with poise and beauty, more powerful than magic itself, perhaps. He is not accustomed to feeling attracted to feminine-presenting people, but the indescribable allure is undeniable and making his temples pulsate with confusion. "Do you think she got those tattoos from Saoirse?" The ranger leans over to whisper to Lila.
Grumpy Crow [Cara] BOT 31-07-2023 08:16
The little claws make tiny scraping noises on the varnish as he walks around the food, the noise stops as he is transfixed. There is a roast hog's head His beady eye stares into the blank dead eye of the hog. The blank dead eye stares back He reaches over with his beaks and plucks out the eye, a distinct sucking noise disturbs the almost theatrical silence that fills the room. For a moment the eye sits there seemingly staring out from his beak, then he swallows it down. No longer transfixed by the eye of the boar he sees living, and maybe questionably living, eyes flickering his way "What? You spend this much time as a crow and see if you don't develop urges. Besides, I'm hungry and its food"
Lila BOT 31-07-2023 09:51
Lila doesn't reply to Georg as all of her attention is on the Countess.

Sacross BOT 31-07-2023 13:47
As the necropolitan stares at the countess, he fees no attraction. Even in life he was never attracted to the scaleless pink flesh of humans. In undeath all such urges have been stripes away. No, not attraction but a tinge of jealousy. How is it that both Sacross and the countess were both undead yet she managed to be a picturesque beauty while Sacross remained a corpse. Vampires have all the luck he guesses. Sacross bows his head in deference, thoughts of what a vampire Sacross would look like. "Lady Strahd, glad I can be some help again."

Cara BOT 31-07-2023 19:19

Freezing for a moment she realises that her decision has been made for her, she stays sitting and hopes it will be for the best. She decides to let the others do the talking so far as she possible can, she will watch and learn which is after all why she is here (edited)
DM [Griz] BOT 01-08-2023 06:24
She smiles at everyone individually as they offer up their services willingly, eagerly. Taking a sip of the wine she places it down, uncrosses her legs and leans foward, dropping her elbows to the table and clasping her hands in front of her face. "That was quite something you uncovered in your last little escapade my little cherubs. Cara-" She turns to face Cara directly as she addresses her "You may not be aware, but the rest of these lovely people that join you did quite a bit of legwork in efforts against our mutual foe and their minions. They were extremely successful in retrieving a rather critical map, a map which is why I have called you all here today." She turns her attention back to the group as a whole. "While your collective efforts yielded valuable information, we still face several issues... The first being accuracy. This map was simply reconstructed by the lovely Lila here, it was not the original, and as such there is room for... error." A sharpness in her eyes can be felt from the ranger as she speaks. "Secondly, not knowing *why* these locations are where they are, I would like to know as much as possible without casuing any more significant.. disturbance. There was a swift and forceful reaction to your incursion last time, one that I very much wish to not repeat. Should we show too much interest, Vecna may get spooked, change tactics, increase security... all outcomes I would prefer to avoid as long as possible." She takes another sip of her wine, waiting for the follow up before continuing

DM [Griz] BOT 01-08-2023 10:31
She turns her head to address Georg, and gives a half smile, one difficult to discern if she is frustrated by the half-handed insult, or simply trying to remain hospitable. "Dear boy, it is not as simple as you think. A powerful lich, in a land of the dead... The very essence that permeates these lands *is* their power. While mine may come from the living, among other things, theirs comes directly from my table scraps. It took me *a very long time* to lock them away the first time, before meddling morons released him..." Her eyes flash red, one or two sharpened nails scrape across the dining table, forming perfect little spirals of dark wood that curl out from under their point. "That was never like this. I believe they will be deep underground, somehere I cannot sense, nor see... And I believe your little map is key to our next steps." She seems to struggle to release her clawed hand from it's locked position on the table, but does so and leans back, clasping her hands in her lap. To Nagrom she gives an smile "Oh darling, you around my table should consider yourselves *my* capable generals, loyal and capable, perhaps learning still, but far more effective than most. As for cover stories, none should be required if you do your job right.." She snaps her fingers and Rahadin approaches the table, rolling out the map that previously was supplied by Lila, stabbing four small Damascus blades in each corner just enough to secure it to the table.

Cara BOT 01-08-2023 13:15
The word lich echoes in her mind, the dark gem of a memory glints at her almost as if to mock her. A vampire and a lich face one another, it is a new dark twist on a story that sits in her mind with perfect clarity. She gently put her hand on the arm of Georg and speaks, not taking her eyes off the Countess for a moment "One does not simply kill a lich" She watches the flash of anger from the vampire and she waits, not wishing to speak until the anger subsided at least a little. As Rahadin walks forward with the map she glances over with interest then looks back at the countess. That the count cannot deal with this matter himself is momentous, it means he is not all powerful in this land, it means he knows concern if not fear, it means there might be an opening if only she can find it. Sat in the centre of power of the oppressor of this land she feels a spark of hope in all these things. "I believe you have agents in your employ Your Ladyship, agents so good at their subtle work that they barely have a reputation. Would I be correct in thinking that at least in part your reason for hiring us is that we need not be seen as your agents and you would prefer that it be kept that way? Ideally our work would go unnoticed but when there is capable opposition we can never know if we will achieve an ideal outcome." She pauses for a moment "Then the question is what new knowledge do you need the most?"
Sacross BOT 01-08-2023 14:31

1
Lila BOT 02-08-2023 00:13
Lila's have been glued to the map since Rahadin brought it out. She feels a mixture of pride and apprehension. It was she who had spotted the map in the dark paladin's chamber, she who had sketched it from memory and delivered it to the Countess. But she cannot help but worry. What if she made a mistake? Misremembered a detail? What if she was confused by the flickering purple light in that cave? What if she is letting the Countess down? The gulp as Lila swallows the lump in her throat is audible.
DM [Griz] BOT 02-08-2023 03:32
A quizzical look crosses her face as Cara speaks "You undersell yourselves dear girl. Being seen, no matter the insurgent, is detrimental to the cause. You are here because you all possess unique abilities that make you stand out candidates for such a task... you are alive." She looks with a sidewards glance at Sacross as she continues, the corner of her lip curling slightly "Mostly. Would you not consider that of strategic benefit when dealing with a foe that is literally fuelled by the dead? I certainly would. As far as your query of *what* you are tasked to seek, I believe I have already made myself quite clear - I want confirmation of the map here our dear Lila provided. Based off your recounting of the last incursion, we already have a rough idea of what is happening deep beneath... Construction, organisation and planning, substantial magic amplification. These things, and the viral response to your presence would indicate locations are of great value. Now..." She gives Rahadin another nod as she stands from her chair, slowly gliding over by Georg. The pale man reaches into his breast pocket and pulls from it 5 small, perfectly spherical metallic objects. They are dull grey and contain very faint etched lines that seem to weave and wind across their surface in no particular discernable pattern. Rahadin places them down on the table by Strahd as she continues, picking one up between thumb and forefinger. "These are the second task. As you confirm locations, I would like them marked. You are to embed one of these in each of the entrances to the locations, do your best to obscure them somewhat, short of burying them." She places it carefully back with the others, and proceeds to lean forward across the table so she can reach the map with her long, pale arms.
DM [Griz] BOT 02-08-2023 03:32
For Georg, it is hard to tell whether the Countess is actively aware of her proximity, position and presentation to him, but the long slit that runs up the thigh of the long elegant crimson dress reveals well and truly up past the midpoint of her thigh as she does so. From the other side of the table Sacross and Nagrom see a devious smile across her face as she begins to tap at the map "If the map is correct, it appears that there are 5 locations in total, each one bordering a body of water... Seemingly this makes sense given you established that the water was in some way powering the subterranean construction. You are **not** to enter and explore as you did last time, we need location, we need subtlety, not more of the same."

Nagrom Eks BOT 02-08-2023 04:11

How much of the sphere must be exposed? Can we hide it in a crevice in stone? Can we put it inside a mouse's skull? How far from the entrance do they need to be placed? Also, does subtlety extend to avoiding encounters in the surrounding forests? You mentioned that they hide deep underground. Should we expect they have eyes above ground, or will they likely be oblivious to our approach?"
DM [Griz] BOT 02-08-2023 04:18
She nods to Nagrom "Questions I can handle dear, questions show forethought, and caution. All such things I will always appreciate. The sensors can be obscured, just not buried. Be as creative as you wish. As for depth, somewhere in the entrance tunnels you spoke of should suffice, I believe... New threats require new tactics, these are part of that." Still leaned across the table, she continues "Just avoid poking the nest. When you are outside, you are with me, if you catch my drift" She gives them a wink. "When you are in the belly of the beast, you are exposed and disconnected, two places you ought not to be, especially when we do not want to be alerting them. I cannot say what kind of defense, if any, they have worked on since your last little sashay"
Sacross BOT 02-08-2023 05:22

Cara BOT 02-08-2023 07:29

Lila BOT 02-08-2023 10:37
"Can we kill the guards as long as we don't go inside?" Lila asks , already envisioning a careful, focused strike to take out sentries without alerting those within. "Will leaving such evidence of our interference be a significant detriment to your plans, my Qu- my Lady?"
Cara BOT 02-08-2023 14:14
Once again she speaks up quietly, doing her best not to get caught in up the theatricality of the Countess and instead to maintain her own act. The act of someone who is confident and knows what they are doing "I take it that whatever we do at each of the five places we should make every effort not to connect those things in the mind of the lich? If they see nothing there is nothing to connect but if they see something it should not give the lich any clues that it is a concerted effort. Because if those metal balls are magical in any way and a lich makes a real effort to find them I presume the lich would succeed. Would it be best to avoid anything that might attract the attention of the lich to the areas where we put these?" Slipping further into character she looks at the metal balls with a slightly quizzical look, as if the sight of the Countess almost laying across the table in front of Georg was just her average Wednesday
DM [Griz] BOT 02-08-2023 23:54
As the questions come thick and fast, the Countess remains somewhat composed, leading back up away from the map for a moment. "If your job is done right, dear Sacross, there should be no need for "spares".... However." She gives Rahadin a nod, they produce an additional orb and place it with the others. "I would prefer the job completed with a degree of incompetence, then not at all." She turns to Lila, her face dropping its smile. "I care very little who you kill my girl. You know how many of you crawl across my lands now? Always interfering, always meddling in affairs above your pay grade... The Lich would have the same experience daily, guards or not, my concern is not with the perception of any random adventurer scouring the landscape and causing a ruckus, my concern is with the successful implanting of these-" She drags the point of a nail across one of the spheres, rolling it around a little. "- without detection, of confirming our site locations, and of doing as little as possible to kick the nest, such as going in and trying to actively clean them out with all of that oozing, unjustified confidence - we know full well the level of response to just a handful of intruders, do we not?" The last aspects of her hospitable demeanour drop away as she speaks, a sharpness replacing the honey and silk mannerisms she has reasonably maintained until this point. "I do believe in all of your abilities, you exceeded expectations last time and I believe you can do it again, but if *you* don't think you are up for this task, you can just leave... *no one* will think any less of you I am sure." Perception 25 Anyone paying enough attention would notice the corner of Rahadin's lips curl ever so slightly
DM [Griz] BOT 02-08-2023 23:55
She nods at Cara "more good insight from our newcomer.. But rest assured, these little things will not be detected by any normal means. Caution and subtlety will certainly pay higher dividends than the alternative."
Lila BOT 03-08-2023 01:24
The her expression is stoic as usual, there's a flicker of something -- like a flinch as the Countess talks down to Lila like she's a child being scolded. Lila swallows down another lump in her throat and remains silent.
Sacross BOT 03-08-2023 02:28
Sacross nods at the addition of the extra stone. "I hope to bring this one back at the end of all this. Anyway I think this is straight forward now. Find them locations in the map, observe, and hide them there stones."
DM [Griz] BOT 03-08-2023 02:42

Nagrom Eks BOT 03-08-2023 02:48
"I have a serpentine owl that can be used for 8 hours every 48 hours. I fear that won't be enough for our plans"
Sacross BOT 03-08-2023 02:49
"I can conjure up a horse for myself. Got a broom which lets me get around too." Sacross looks at the others to answer.
Strahd von Zarovich [Griz] BOT 03-08-2023 03:04
She nods "Indeed, many means of transport these days will limit you. So then-" The grin widens "I have a gift for you all my little treasures.. I do like to spoil those I care about, contrary to popular belief." Rahadin, who seems to have taken the concept of Sacross' portable hole and refine it into some kind of super-dimensional waistcoat pockets, continues to produce more small items from the fabric that presses firmly against his ribcage. He places a small carved obsidian figure on the table in front of each of you, much like a chess piece, it is smooth and polished, depicting the form of a Pegasus reared on its hind legs. Strahd smiles as she places her pressed hands to her mouth, eyes darting eagerly between each of you. "These wondrous little objects will transform into misty, spectacular mounts to ferry you all around as you please, just be careful... For their speed, they are rather fragile..."
1
Georg BOT 03-08-2023 03:26
"Thank you, countess, that is most generous of you." Georg bows his head in thanks, before examining the figurine more carefully. The ranger then pulls out his wand that allows him to see magic and waves it around the spying stones that Sacross is holding, testing out whether a simple detect magic spell would reveal the presence of these orbs.
Nagrom Eks BOT 03-08-2023 03:37
*Nagrom's eyes go wide. He toiled for weeks on his Serpentine Owl. The materials alone cost him a very large stack of platinum. And now Strahd is giving each of them something so valuable? For the first time Nagrom looks at Strahd, not as an apex predator ready to devour him at any moment, but as an extraordinarily beautiful woman with poise, musical talent, and generosity. His fear was replaced with doubt. Perhaps his reluctance was misplaced? Perhaps being in service to Lady Strahd would not be a bad thing. She did say we should consider ourselves her capable generals. Could that be genuine?* "This figurine is exquisite and is exactly what this mission needs. Thank you for being so thoughtful and supplying us with tools that will allow us to quickly deliver a successful outcome."
2
Rahadin [Griz] BOT 03-08-2023 03:39
As Georg waves the wand around Rahadin steps forward suddenly, a fast hand landing on the tip of the magical implement and holding it. He leans down to Georg's level "Tut tut... You should know better *boy* than to pull a wand in here... Let alone to question the Countess' word." The points of his fangs protrude below his top lip as he speaks, Georg can see the quiver in the muscles around his mouth as he speaks.
Strahd von Zarovich [Griz] BOT 03-08-2023 03:40
She waves a hand "It is ok Rahadin, the young man is curious, and wants to satiate his own concerns... let him. We are all friends here."
1
DM [Griz] BOT 03-08-2023 03:40
The lap dog reluctantly lets go of the wand, and takes a step backward from Georg, standing upright again.
1
Strahd von Zarovich [Griz] BOT 03-08-2023 03:42
She turns and smiles to Nagrom "But of course. We cannot have you going in "half cocked" as they like to say these days, I never quite understood the reference.." She watches as Georg waves their wand, and no magic reflects from the small orbs, the corner of her lip curling once more. "So then-" She claps her hands "You have your task, you have your steeds, you have my grace. Shall there be anything else?"
Sacross BOT 03-08-2023 04:09
Sacross is truly impressed by this gift. "My thanks is left Countess. This gift... I gotta say I'm grateful. I'll do my best for in this, and this Flyin' steed will sure help."
Georg BOT 03-08-2023 06:01
Feeling his pulse quicken when Rahadin snatched his wand, and then getting the vote of confidence from the Countess, Georg is breathing fast, "thank you, Countess, we shall not let you down." Turning to the group, he smiles, "this should be fun, right?! For once we're not asked to go kill someone or something!!" The ranger says hopefully to his companions.
Cara BOT 03-08-2023 06:10
As Rahadin extended the exquisite carved pegasus towards her, a glimmer of surprise flickered in Cara's eyes. The intricately detailed obsidian, no larger than a chess piece, exuded an aura of enchantment that captivated her senses. "Thank you, Duchess Strahd. This is a truly remarkable gift." She turns it over in her hands, studying each facet of its carving like she would study each facet of a recovered memory. Then, startled and flinching back slightly she watches the sudden unexpected interplay of Georg, Rahadin and Strahd. The moment of rapture with the pegasus is broken, she carefully puts into a soft pouch making a mental note to herself that the Countess has the ability to locate and perhaps watch over the items she has handed out to them. Seeing Georg making light of the situation with Rahadin she smiles back at him. "It should be more fun than the usual kill or be killed. Stealth and deception rather than blood and guts, they say a change is as good as a rest and this does sound like a change" (edited)
1
1
Grumpy Crow [Cara] BOT 03-08-2023 07:15
As Grumpy perched himself at the lavish feast laid out on the table, he could hardly believe his luck. The tantalising aroma of sumptuous dishes wafted through the air, filling his senses with an array of delectable flavors. His beady eyes glistened with delight as he pecked at the assortment of delectable treats, indulging in a feast fit for nobility. With each peck and nibble, Grumpy's scruffy feathers seemed to puff up with contentment. His tiny crow heart soared with satisfaction. He hopped from dish to dish, his claws scratching on the table, savouring the succulent meats, rich gravies, and flavourful vegetables. But above all else he sought out anything cooked with the eyes still init, each one plucked out sent waves of pleasure through his tiny crow body. All around him there were revelations, schemes and moments of threatening danger. He either didn't notice or didn't care. He just stuffed his beak with more food than seemed possible for such a small bird to eat
Lila BOT 03-08-2023 11:01
Lila picks up the figurine and looks at it, though her mind is elsewhere. The others' words wash over her and she catches only a few words here and there. "Stealth" and "killing" in particular. She clutches the figurine tightly in one hand and stands up. "I do not know about the rest of you, but I am ready to get started."
ROI (Wiz) BOT 03-08-2023 13:37
ROI watches in envy as the crow eats eyes in front of everyone. Crows...He's not saving any for anyone else.

Georg BOT 03-08-2023 16:14
Georg follows Lila's leads and stands up, not eating anything besides sucking down another glass of ruby wine, seemingly collecting himself finally from the Countess' confident flaunting of her glorious body. "Come on, drake boy, time to go sneaking around!" The ranger calls to something beneath the heavy dining table. He frowns when he sees that the little bits of food he has thrown on the floor for the Drake throughout the conversation have all remained untouched. Normally, the Drake would voraciously and appreciatively gulped all of this food down. "What's with you?" Georg asks. "You're usually so at ease, I've never seen you turn down snacks before?!" The silver drake doesn't even hiss back, but nervously extracts himself from under the table, seeming very unnerved and looking eager to leave the Countess' castle. (edited)
Cara BOT 03-08-2023 19:41

She bows slightly as she rises "Your Ladyship" Then she nods politely to Rahadin, not speaking as his name had not been spoken "I think I understand your needs well enough, I will take the spheres if I may and we can be on our way. Everyone collects their newly acquired gifts, the small parcel of spheres, and their grit, and makes their way from the dining hall. Strahd remains behind, standing with folded arms and a small wave as you leave. Rahadin escorts you to the castle doors and into the courtard and the brisk Barovian air. As he bids you farewell, he hands you the map from the table, before turning and returning into the castle.

Nagrom Eks BOT 07-08-2023 15:02
Believing he is able to now speak without a filter, and oblivious to the possibility that Strahd or Rahadin is listening through the sensors, Nagrom lets the buildup of words erupt from his mouth, "I think Countess Strahd likes the emotions she elicits from us. Fear, awe, reverence, resentment, love, hate. She seems to enjoy being able to take someone at one extreme and moving them to the other. In any event, we have a mission to accomplish. I am partial to placing the sensors in mouse skulls. We would need to strip all the flesh from the bone -- we wouldn't want a scavenger to think it was a meal -- so that it seems to be just a discarded scrap of bone. I imagine we will encounter guards and perhaps glyphs and traps. I only have 2 scrolls of invisibility and cannot cast the spell without the scrolls. If we swing by town, perhaps I could commission 3 more. I can also dispel glyphs a few times a day without scrolls, but perhaps it makes sense to purchase a few of those scrolls as well. Speaking of scrolls, has anyone else heard the rumor that Rahadin was behind the library fire? Do you think there is any chance he acts independently, in what he believes is in the best interests of the Countess, or is he always operating under her direct orders? How far away is each point of the map? I didn't want to ask earlier. Is swinging by town even feasible? I'm a bit turned around."

2
DM [Griz] BOT 09-08-2023 21:06
You all step down into the clearing beyond the castle gates, each holding your small obsidian carving in your hands. With the utterance of unique phrases, a flash of black envelops each of you, for a moment there is nothing - no air, no light, no sound, no feeling... And overwhelming "nothingness" engulfs you. As quickly as it appears, the sensation vanishes as the swirling black mist jumps away from you and begins to swirl and dance in the ground before you. It waits patiently for you each to continue reciting the phrase, cautiously you each do so, and after a minute passes, where nothing stood previously now stands several large, inky black forms Pegasus. Difficult to focus on, the creatures are just as translucent as they are solid, shifting in and out of view with the white mist that plays and interracts with the dark, like old friends reunited.
DM [Griz] BOT 09-08-2023 21:12
Each of you approach, and the steeds lower their heads in acknowledgement, allowing you to mount them. Wings beat hard and the visual form if smoke once more shifts in and out of view, slowly, each of you rise. As though aware of your plans and destination, each takes off into the air in a neat line, whisking you away quickly into the thick mist.
DM [Griz] BOT 09-08-2023 21:13
## Day 1, Ugavr (Wine Moon), 11:00am.
1
Cara BOT 09-08-2023 21:22
She stands in shock for a moment as the dark nothingness surrounds her. For the briefest moment she wonders if she is between lives again, if she died and somehow did not notice. As the sensation swirls away her rising feeling of panic at being alone again subsides. She recites the words, relief carved on her face as she does so "That was...unexpected and unpleasant. But we have mounts now and they will save us a lot of time. Shall we land a good safe distance from the pools so our mounts do not feel threatened and vanish from under us? Unless I can find a way to not die in a big fall I don't want to take any chances at all with these mounts" She looks at the mount closely, it seems almost ridiculous to try to ride such an insubstantial thing but this is the magic that they have been given. Half expecting to fall on her backside she climbs up onto the shadow pegasus
1
Cara BOT 09-08-2023 21:24
Shaken by the experience Cara pays little attention to her surroundings. Nor does Grumpy for the two of them are deep in silent conversation the whole of the journey, Cara struggling to explain to her spirit guide quite why the feeling of nothingness was so terrifying to her
Sacross BOT 09-08-2023 21:30
Sacross digs in a pocket and flicks a feather fall token into the air towards Cara, it flows through the air as if carried in the breeze before landing in her hand. "That should help with the big fallin' problem. Though I reckon we should still park these fellas away from where we will be doin' our investagatin'. Don't want them goin' poof before we can see as many o' these points of interest as possible. Anyone else be needin' a token? I gots one more left not countin' the one that'll save my rottin' hide."

Cara BOT 09-08-2023 21:49

It might even save some innocent passing farmer from being struck by a heavy metal-clad woman falling out of the sky. That would double your good deed" She says with a hint of humour in her voice

1
DM [Griz] BOT 10-08-2023 22:48
As your steeds carry you swiftly through the mist, the feeling is unlike any you've felt before now.. Almost as if the steeds were one with the very mist you fly through, there is a certain weightlessness that even other magicks don't quite match. You feel held, ferried by some undulating force as expansive as the sea, and it fills you with comfort. You fly for just shy of an hour or so before the familiar form of the Tser pool begins to form a faint grey silhouette down below... The steeds slow, and begin to softly descend down several hundred feet out from the mouth of the first cave, from your vantage point the entire space appears to be unguarded and silent. Placing your feet on the grey dry dirt below, each of the black wispy Pegasus choral themselves around a tree amid the dense trees. Each of you stand facing south, with no clear path forward outside of pushing through the reasonably dense shrub.
Lila BOT 11-08-2023 00:15
"Keep an eye out for any geographic features that you remember from last time," Lila says, beginning to look around but not moving away from the group.
Nagrom Eks BOT 11-08-2023 01:46
"Perhaps I should join Georg and Lila, just in case some magic is necessary"
Sacross BOT 11-08-2023 01:47
Sacross guides his flying steed near the entrance of the caverns this group previously explored. A little ways off remembering it was guarded last time. "ROI, think you can find a mouse? I'll hang back. I ain't the senakiest."
Georg BOT 11-08-2023 04:00
"Drake boy, hangout with uncle Sacross. You're also not very sneaky so you should follow Sacross and Cara's lead." The drake grumbles but obeys.
Sacross BOT 11-08-2023 04:04
"If ya'll give me some time I can find the nearest rat so Skinny here can go cuttin' out its skull." Sacross begins casting locate plants and animals, specifically looking for rats. While he is not that attuned to Mother Nature, he can sweet talk her into a little info.

They live and die fast. Maybe put down a few traps" She opens up her bag and looks inside "There! I still have some rations I've never had any need for. I can use some of that as bait for snares"

Lila BOT 11-08-2023 20:55

She briefly repeats that in her head to check if there were too many knows... "But I think if we move slowly and look carefully for familiar landmarks we should be able to find it. We know the entrance faced south so we should hook around and approach from the north."
Cara BOT 11-08-2023 21:10

Grumpy [Cara] BOT 11-08-2023 21:14

DM [Griz] BOT 11-08-2023 22:28
You gather yourselves and begin to push forward through the thick shrub, moving as quietly as you can as you go. The mist swirls and licks at your heels, it plays with the foreign materials of your boots, rushing back with each impact, sucking back in with each lift of the boot. Those of you who push somewhat ahead of the others can see the entrance of the cave come into view ahead, and just as before from the air, the space appears abandoned, silent.
Lila BOT 11-08-2023 22:50
Lila takes out a scroll from her pocket. She whispers ancient Shadowfell incantations while moving the scroll in the air, following the points of the compass. As the parchment disintegrates, the air fills with the scent of burnt spruce and mistletoe. Mist and shadow shift and twist around the three adventurers like a veil.
DM [Griz] BOT 12-08-2023 00:37
As Nagrom and Lila move up through the shrub, the scene before them continues to remain silent, still. The air around them does give off the faint smell of burning however, possibly wafting from the bowels of the cavern below, it is sulphurous and acrid.
Nagrom Eks BOT 12-08-2023 00:47
Nagrom pulls out his wand of magic detection and expends a charge
DM [Griz] BOT 12-08-2023 00:52
As Nagrom flicks their wand, everything around them is illuminated. The trees, the ground, the small bugs that flit through the air.
Nagrom Eks BOT 12-08-2023 01:03
Nagrom puts up his hand and mouths "One moment" to the others. He starts focusing on individual things around him to examine the auras and determine whether they are all the same Schools of Magic. First the trees, then the ground, then the entrance to the cave.
DM [Griz] BOT 12-08-2023 01:17
Nagrom scans the scene, but the magic is more complicated than they have previously encountered. One thing is clear, they are all, even those who hung back, doused in illusion, abjuration, and necrotic magic.
Nagrom Eks BOT 12-08-2023 01:43
Nagrom uses his earring of message to relay the information to Sacross and then carefully moves forward, looking for glyphs or anything else that is different from the surroundings.
DM [Griz] BOT 12-08-2023 02:01
Barely a step forward from their position and Nagrom immediately freezes in place. Their eyes widen as panic, pain, terror, take a hold of every muscle in their body. The area around them illuminates in an all-too-familar green hue, the same that had filled the narrow hallway deep in the tunnels below. They feel the synapses in their mind, the capilleries in their fingers all burn in unison, agonising and complete. By their side, both Lila and Georg are trapped in poses mid movement too, experiencing the same trauma, the same overwhelming pain as they scream silent screams. Back behind them, Cara and Sacross see very little except for an increase in light levels around the rest of the party, their creeping forward movement barely discernable from their new, frozen positions...
1
Georg BOT 12-08-2023 06:42
Not...fucking... again.. Georg thinks to himself in agony, tears of pain silently running down his cheeks. He almost wants to laugh at the irony of always ending up locked by magic, in pain, when he's with Lila.
Cara BOT 12-08-2023 13:44
She frowns as she sees them freeze, she looks around but can't see anything that would cause them to stop so drastically and hold still. Quetly she speaks to the others near ner "Can anyone see anything? Why did they freeze like that?" She glances questioningly up at where she knows Grumpy is
Grumpy [Cara] BOT 12-08-2023 13:45
The leprechaun somehow feels she can see him picking his nose even though he is invisible and swiftly stops what he is doing and tries to pay attention "I didn't see a thing kiddo, they just stopped walking"
Cara BOT 12-08-2023 13:51
Still frowning she looks but she can't see anything to explain their odd behaviour "What am I not seeing?" Unsure what to do she falls back on what she does best. She reaches into her memory and finds a recollection of thick fog swirling through a forest. With an effort of will she makes the memory real, or at least close enough to real to fool the senses. She steps into the swirling mist, concealed from any normal eyes. Its the abnormal eyes she is worried about
Grumpy [Cara] BOT 12-08-2023 13:52
Back on the job the leprechaun flies up further to try to get a better view, he still can't see much
Sacross BOT 12-08-2023 13:58

Nagrom Eks BOT 12-08-2023 14:13
............
Sacross BOT 12-08-2023 14:51
Sacross pulls out a scroll from his bag and casts dispel magic on Lila, hoping it will snap her out of the effect. "I reckon we hang back a bit. We could trigger whatever hit Skinny, RBF, and pretty boy up there." Sacross says to Cara, referring to Nagrom, Lila and Georg respectively. "Hangin' back, we may get the jump on anyone comin' out to investigate."
Cara BOT 12-08-2023 16:18
She replies quietly, a soft voice from the enveloping fog ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs a trap it‚Äôs no use rushing in until we understand it. If things get bad I can heal them from here. I will stay hidden for now‚Äù
Lila BOT 13-08-2023 01:28
Lila feels control of herself return like an immense wave of relief. She turns and grabs her closest ally and drags him out of the horrible glow. The increase in light has been no help to the night-goggle-wearing-elf and it is only once she's able to take a moment to collect herself (and drink a much needed potion) that she realizes that it's Nagrom that she's pulled out and not Georg. "Oh. It's you," she says with horror covered over by an affected tone of callous disdain.

Cara BOT 13-08-2023 08:52

I hope so because it looks like going in there is a death sentence whatever it is that is there." An idea flashes into her mind, she looks on the ground and does not see dead squirrels everywhere "He said illusion. If all life was dead all around we would have noticed the lack of it. If the animals fell for the illusion they would be dead on the ground and we would have seen them. So maybe the illusionist forgot that animals have different senses, maybe the animals can smell or hear something wrong and not die" She reaches for a patch on her clothes and her fingers find one shaped like a little patch dog. She pulls it off and throws it on the ground in front of her The patch shimmers with suppressed magic the the magic flows through it. The fabric shifts and grows, fills out and becomes alive. A mastiff stands in front of Cara looking slightly surprised to exist "Lead me that way girl if you can, if you will. And if you won't then I know your senses tell you something mine can't see" She points (Pointing East on the map thinking to go around whatever magical trap the others fell into)

DM [Griz] BOT 13-08-2023 22:46
As everyone draws closer the air pulsates out and around you, ripples of forceful energy surging out from the now bright location. As Georg's Drake bravely hurtles head first into the area to retrieve their master, they too are immediatly stunned, and fall to the ground like a stone gargoyle. Nagom and Lila are grateful to feel their chest rise and lower with each breath once more, but there is an unpleasant tingling that surges through their extremities, it burns hot and makes even touching their own fingers to one another hurt, as though the very nerve endings that cover their fingers and skin have been scorched from the inside. The group scurry to quickly adjust to what took place, with Georg and their minions still motionless in the aura, soft green light radiating off them.

DM [Griz] BOT 14-08-2023 22:58

Georg BOT 15-08-2023 02:10
Georg's consciousness was halfway down the tunnel toward the gray light when suddenly the axis of the tunnel tilts until it's a chute and Georg is tumbling straight down, falling hard back into his aching, paralyzed body. The familiar sensation of a healing spirit drizzling him with healing warmth is strangely accompanied by the press of two strong lithe arms that cradle him. "Lyon?" He mumbles in his semi conscious state, without opening his eyes. "You have been slacking in your workouts. How did your arms get so skinny? Or are they not feeding you enough? Don't worry, I'll hunt all the game in these woods to feed you." He mumbles feverishly. As he forces himself to open one eye and sees Lila's concerned expression, perhaps mixed with a bit of what might be annoyance, and what might be relief, he smiles and closes his eyes again. "Oh! How I ache! I think I'm gonna need mouth to mouth resuscitation!!" He performatively cries out, even though his limbs are still locked.
Lila BOT 15-08-2023 02:23

The Mage Hand holding the head in place, Nagrom cutting away the flesh until he sees bone, then using Prestidigitation to clean the visible bone, and then cutting away more flesh to reveal more bone and repeating the process. He occasionally uses Prestidigitation to create small trinkets, such as tweezers or an awl to assist him. Occasionally, he magically cleans the viscera off his clothes and hands. Once the skull is all that remains, he placed the sphere inside Finally, he takes out his Hammer of Township to cast Mending on any fractures that he might have caused. He then hands the finished product to Cara.*

Nagrom Eks BOT 21-08-2023 00:08
*Seeing that the harmful magic did not interact with the inert stick or mage hand, Nagrom starts rummaging around his bag for a scroll. Once he finds it, he looks up and imagines the path Grumpy took. He picks a point 30 feet away along the path and re-casts Mage Hand on that spot. Nagrom then starts counting backward from 60. With the broom in one hand and the scroll in the other, he casts the spell from the scroll. As the scroll crumbles to ash, Nagrom disappears. Before the ash falls to the ground, Nagrom hops on the magic broom and zips to the spectral hand floating in space. 56..55...54 He wills the Hand to move another 30 ft in the air, and closes the distance with the flying broom. 50...49...48 About half way there. He moves both the hand and himself together to the point grumpy hid the probe. 38...37...36 Once there, he floats above the brush and sticks and moves the hand to the inside of the cave to see if anything happens*
