GRIÃ∂Z ‚ï† Seron¬≥ ‚ï£ 30-11-2023 22:09
## Deck the Halls
DM [Griz] BOT 01-12-2023 11:42
In the shadow's realm where darkness lingers like the wraiths in twilight's embrace, a matron's call reaches out to a band of wanderers diverse. Lady Seraphina Shadowheart, a luminary of the social tapestry of this cursed domain, extends a metaphorical hand to beckon you. Atop a hill nestled quietly behind the fortified walls of Vallaki, a mansion of yore, draped in the familiar shroud of melancholy that pervades all things great and small of these lands awaits you... In recent weeks and months, murmurs across the mists have spoken of passages and corridors deep below the sooiled soils above. Each space carefully unveiled by the hands of those who dared to tread the labyrinthin's depths.. Those familiar with Vecna and their associates also speak of a hall, a spectral canvas that seems to draw the gaze of the elite, the affluent, and on this day, the veiled Lady in her mansion.. As Yule Tide approaches, her public invitation spoke of seeking those who would assist her in breathing life into the grand hall. A banquet she sought, a macabre revelry to celebrate the transition from one year to the next unmatched in these lands before now. Imagine, if you will, twisted decorations casting shadows, tables burdened with the most exceptional delicacies, and the grand hall itself, an echoing vessel of ancient tithes Transformed! A place for joy, merriment and ignited passion could fill such a space, and drown out the dark work of a threat yet proven to be greater than the Vampire lord himself... And so we stand together, at the gates of change, invited to embark on a quest to weave enchantment into the "Halls of Despair", where cursed baubles stir, and new stories of pain, or joy? wait with baited breath. (edited)
DM [Griz] BOT 01-12-2023 11:43
## [The Manor Courtyard](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/1101440631429136384/1180184939292012666/1553b3d643cb9243e752edea4505de7f.jpg?ex=657c7fe0&is=656a0ae0&hm=eab8368582d34d9e2b5fdad4b9104a1b44dee4dec527f1cdfa4e3fd3e77f7c9c&) As you all collect yourselves and push into the large courtyard a man greets you. Elorian, so he was called, was the butler of the manor here. He was a gaunt man with a tired, worn form. Skin pale as moonlight that lights up the mist he stands in. The building is beautiful, if not a little sad itself - the fading glamour of decades passed still clinging to the mansion's fa√ßade. You are greeted warmly and ushered in, taken through the home's grand doors and into the drawing room. As you all enter, you find a scene worthy of painting before you - warm firelight coats the tables and chairs that huge it to the west, while bookshelves and small lanterns seem to fill the east. Sat quietly by the fire a woman is seated. She smiles wide and beckons you to join her... (edited)
Moondrop BOT 01-12-2023 14:39
*Moondrop steps into the shadowy courtyard, her senses alert to the eerie ambiance that envelops the mansion - likely haunted. She follows the butler Elorian into the drawing room and beholds the tableau of faded elegance and haunting beauty. Moondrop's casts a skeptical gaze upon Lady Shadowheart and Elorian. She trusts little in Barovia, at least little of things that make their home here - that are of Barovia. She trusts her companions, and greets them warmly. Friendhips forged in the fires of combat. Moondrop maintains a cautious yet open demeanor, wary of this woman she does not know. Her companions - all ones she has fought beside before, whether in the arena or defending the town from fiends - stand beside her. As they approach, she wards herself and Trellum against death, as she has had far too many near death experiences by his side.* (edited)
Sacross BOT 01-12-2023 15:48
Sacross lands in the courtyard, ROI perched on his shoulder and pruning non existent feathers. The warlock takes in the surroundings, appreciating the ambiance on the manor. Reminds him of home, though that brings little comfort. He spots Trellum and Moondrop, his fellow champions of the arena and gives them a wave. At least they wouldn't be dealing with Razzle's antics today. He looks up at his gracious host and gives a polite bow, mustering all the charm allowed a necropolitain. This being Barovia Sacross expects her to soon be swinging swords, claws or spells his way, but that don't mean he can't be courteous in the meantime. "Pleasure to be makin' your acquaintance miss. Mighty fine place you be havin' here." Sacross nods to the others gathered here. Recognizing them from around town but not knowin' their names. "I'm Sacross, no surname unfortunately. Seein' how's I ain't likley to be siring heirs anytime soon it don't bother me much. As part of introductions ya'll mind scribbling your names in this here book? Else-wise I'll be forgettin' them."

Trellum BOT 01-12-2023 16:33
Trellum joins the others from the sky, landing with a whisper of owlin feathers. He eyed the area on the way in, but hte deep shadows keep his prying eyes from leanring much. He brushes his leather duster and pull it around himself to keep the chill at bay. "Hello friends, good to see we're all back together." He turns to the butler, "Magi Trellum, presenting myself at Lady Shadowheart's request."
Moondrop BOT 01-12-2023 16:54
Moondrop purses her lips, whiskers twitching, wary of signing her name over to Sacross' book like that. But it's not truly her name, written like that, is it? Not her own personal sigil, known only to her? She hopes so. She writes her name into Sacross' book. "Don't go around abusing that, now!" she says, surprisingly serious for such an unassuming little mouse. She turns to Lady Shadowheart. "Moondrop, servant of the moon, m`lady."

Reports said that someone caught a glimpse of it deep in the lower catacombs - some rather grand staircase lead to its home, but those who went looking through the darkness from the landing and chose to leave it be.. such a shame though. Finally, there is a Lightless metal rod, it is made of bright silver and has a hand that curls around the hilt, yet the metal reflects no light. This one, I am not sure where it is - but I have heard among the whispers that it is down there, somewhere." She pauses, and eats another cracker with cheese

DM [Griz] BOT 23-12-2023 00:29
Despite some rather unfortunate directions from the small mouse, Wick rolls with it and manages to guide the carriage to the entrance eventually. While you lost an hour or two having to double back here and there, the drive we actually rather pleasant, and the cargo is all secure upon arrival. When you do pull up you arrive to something you are yet to have come across so far in your experience or retellings of these tunnels.. Where prior would be a wide open, roughly hewn cave mouth, unassuming and somewhat obscured from any kind of attention, here stands a rather lovely gatehouse. Build from impressive bluestone, the building is not large but certainly makes a point of marking an entrance. Two large metal gates sit closed between the central pillars of the building, with torches softly illuminating bluestone steps that descend down into the earth below. A small turret style outhouse sits to the side of the gate, clearly intended for someone to man and potentially police the entry, though one does have to question what a single person of any skill level would do in this relentless landscape, unless it was Strahd themself perhaps. As you all climb from the carriage you are left with the somewhat awkward process of figuring out how to ferry the goods below, and where you could park the carriage to perhaps, just maybe, keep your agreement if it's safe return.

Sacross BOT 23-12-2023 02:43
Sacross steps out of the carriage and stretches with a loud groan as if the ride unsettled his undead muscles. He takes in the situation with a lazy smack of his lips. "Guessin' the cart stays here" He eyes the crates then the narrow passage way and sighs. His hand lazily makes its way to his pocket and pulls out a pitch black handkerchief. He unfolds it, then again, then again, until he is soon holding a small sheet. Laying the sheet on the ground he gives a shrill whistle. "Come on out boys." After a moment of waiting two skeletons emerge from the cloth. Their mandibles chatter as they stand in attention next to Sacross. "You all keep an eye out on this cart here." To the others Sacross says. "I can send ROI in them tunnels there to scout ahead for us. Past history says he'll be gettin' himself killed and I'll have to resummon him, but at least we'll know there's trouble. As for the cart, these fellas will hopefully ward off any trouble. I could be settin' an alarm on the cart to to let us know if there's trouble." He eyes the crates. "Those things are a bit heavy for me. We can be puttin' um in my portable hole here. Then even ole ROI here can lift em'."

DM [Griz] BOT 30-12-2023 00:54
over the course of the following 10 minutes or so, between Nameless' strength and agility in shifting crates, and the Arcane prowess of the others, you quite easily sort the boxes into divided lots and when all is said and done, what was several ton of heavy equipment now is carried quite easily as a rolled up piece of black cloth grasped between the talons ROI. One should hope the loyal bird be kept safe with such previous cargo. The carriage is stored to the side in some dense shrub and warded by Sacross, and you all stand ready to proceed. As you approach the entrance, passing by the empty booth it's evident that whatever poor soul was stationed there really never had much entertainment. All that lay in the space was a rather uncomfortable looking wooden chair, a romance novel, and a half drunk bottle of cheap whiskey.
GRIÃ∂Z ‚ï† Seron¬≥ ‚ï£ 30-12-2023 00:57
?dm. The cavern passage is quite nice in comparison to some of the past tunnels a few members had experienced, the roughly hewn walls had been smoothed out, and in some spaces even bluestone brick had started to line the walls in a more permanent fashion. There were a series of sconces that contained magical burning torches along the way too, the light quite suitable for any normal person to see.
DM [Griz] BOT 30-12-2023 01:21
As you move, the tunnels slowly but surely take you deeper and deeper below ground. The air feels a little colder with each passing minute, but there isn't the familiar "sticky" sensation that had become so synonymous with the Lichs series of caverns, for anyone who didn't know better, this would seem like any other underground tunnel, with very little sign of "evil" at all. Wick makes the astute assessment as you all move along that there was not much going on. While this may seem... Obvious to others, their assessment had more weight than the words alone imply - it was quiet, there was no distant groans, no softly trickling water behind walls or down obscured, dark passages. No wind softly pushing it's way down the winding path, and barely a muffle from your own boots underfoot. For all intensive purposes it seems the entire complex is totally empty.
Moondrop BOT 30-12-2023 03:42
Moondrop's whiskers twitch nervously. "This is weird. Just... weird. I can't put my paw on it."
Sacross BOT 30-12-2023 04:33
Sacross collects the portable hole from ROI and places it safely in his pocket. He attempts to speak in a whisper but such is beyond him since his deal in the temple of amber. "Ya'll think there's trouble afoot?" He nervously thumbs his blasting rod, looking here and there in the cavernous tunnels. "I ain't see nothing, last time I was down here it was fully o' corpses that didn't know theys was dead. And magical wards that be triggering when you step on them... perhaps we should be lookin' for those." The undead warlock pockets his blasting rod for now and pulls out a crooked wand fashioned by his own hand. A wand of magic detection. "A Bibbidi‚ÄêBobbidi‚ÄêBoo" He says unnecessaryas he triggers the wands magic.
Warr [Wick 11|Ammander 7] -4 30-12-2023 06:18
‚ÄúMakes sense this part‚Äôd be cleaner, what with the fancy gate.‚Äù Wick throws a thumb over his shoulder in the direction of the entrance. ‚ÄúBut somethin made the guard leave in a hurry. Didn‚Äôt even finish his drink, hey?‚Äù
Sacross BOT 30-12-2023 06:26
Perhaps I should be callin' on more help just in casein' there's something down here causin' trouble." The undead's hand reaches k to yet another pocket and pulls out a small brazier. "Give me a sec or two." He pulls out a pipe and with the snap of his finger ignites both the pipe and brazier. The pipe smokes normally but the brazier's flame comes to life. "This fella will stick around the next hour or so. Anyone thinkin' o' finishin' that guards drink?"
Strahd BOT 30-12-2023 15:11
"Can any of you conjure one of those fancy disk things? Preferably multiple if possible. I can get us a horse to make our trekking significantly faster and we can tie each of them together to fashion a train of sorts."
Moondrop BOT 30-12-2023 15:14
"Not me. But a horse and floating wagon sure seems like a good idea."
Sacross BOT 30-12-2023 16:11
Sacross smiles in self satisfaction. "I can do both of y'all give me a minute or too."
ROI (Wiz) BOT 30-12-2023 16:11
Show off.
DM [Griz] BOT 04-01-2024 09:40
With litte effort, you all travel through the passages and within 20 minutes or so, find yourself breaching the smaller spaces and entering what appears to be the grand hall of which Lady Seraphina spoke of. The room is quite impressive, it would have to be at least 200ft long, and almost 60ft or more wide. While the roof remains as a large open void of rough stone and the occasional exposed gemstone, the walls that border the floor are smooth, well laid stonework. There are a series of tables that line the space too, each of some kind of heavy, solid, blackwood. Ambient light trickles into the space from what appears to be small skylights that must funnel the white misty light from the surface down below, in addition to more of the magical torches held in more bass sconces. Unloading the equipment into the space takes very little time at all, and after 20 minutes or so, a neat pile of boxes and equipment is stacked to the southern end of the room, ready for the Ladys "grand party". The similar experience of your entry continues, that of no sound, and no other people. A very quick tour of the space exposes two parallel passages that depart the space from the northwest and northeast corners, as well as two parallel passages that depart from the centre of the east and west walls. You all entered from the south, giving the room a total of five entry points. Given the very little information, and lack of a map, knowing which way leads where is a small challenge, but the information that each room is not exactly far from the central ball room is a small comfort.
Strahd BOT 04-01-2024 12:28
Looking around the chamber the Amnesiac slowly makes a tight circle looking at each entrance before walking towards the eastern entrance peering down it before waving the others over.
Moondrop BOT 04-01-2024 16:27
"This room is vast." comments Moondrop. With a \pop\, she summons her familiar Silverwing, the giant dragonfly, from its pocket dimension. "Here, Silverwing, go take a peek at all those doors. Tell me what you find." With a buzz of its wings, Silverwing takes off to scout. (edited)
Sacross BOT 06-01-2024 05:37
Sacross approaches Strahd. It seems that after investigating all the entrances that look identical to Sacross, Strahd focused on this particular one. "This one any thing special?" Sacross asks, genuinely curious. Perhaps there was something different about this way that the undead couldn't discern.
Trellum BOT 06-01-2024 15:43
Trellum pulls a wand from his cloak and fires it off, a pulse of magic detection flooding out around him as he follows the others around the room.
Warr [Wick 11|Ammander 7] -4 06-01-2024 18:17
